Reviews.Title: “Treats guests horribly; overbooks as a practice, it seems”
Reviews.Author: CNGiller
Reviews.Content: I flew from Seattle to spend two nights in LA, both at the Hotel Angeleno. I had heard good things about the hotel and had made reservations. Don't be fooled: this places treats its guests horribly. Despite having a reservation, I was told upon arrival that the hotel was overbooked -- why hadn't they told me before? why no email, no phone call? why was there no manager available to answer these questions? I was then put in a taxi after midnight to be transported to what turned out to be a lower-grade hotel many miles away. Hotel Angeleno picked up the tab, but I found myself in a room that smelled of smoke with paper-thin walls. I then had to transport myself back to Hotel Angeleno for my second night in town (all my meetings were nearer to this location). I found the accommodations to be decent, but management took a long while to return my calls that day and chose not discount my night at the hotel, when it seemed to me they ought to consider it. I have since heard from others that the hotel may overbook its rooms as a practice. I don't think I'll be staying there again and discourage you from doing so, too.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: HanaleimomTx
Reviews.Content: After reading the review here I was prepared for the worse. I booked my room through priceline.com and knew that I don't have a choice of view. I requested a room facing the back and was given one on 10th floor, on the side. At check in I have the option to upgrade to higher floor for extra $. I don't recall but maybe it was $25/night. From my room, direct view was the building behind the hotel. Staning on the right side of the balcony I could see part of the freeway. With the glass door closed, we weren't bother with the noises. Units are equipped with individual AC units w/o auto temperature shut-off. You must turn on and off manually. No problem for us. There was some noise from the unit but it turned out to be white noise for us. There was no closet but a small armoire is provided next to the TV. The fridge was filled with items available for purchase so you can't use it to store your own items. There was a small in-room safe large enough to store my 13" Macbook. Water pressure was not very strong in my opinion. As others have posted here besides the hotel's restaurant there is eating establishments within walking distance. However, the hotel provides shuttle services to close by areas until 7 PM, I believe. On the plus sides the room was clean and bed was firm. Their toiletry items have beautiful scents. There is mint thyme hair wash, yuzu bergamot creme rinse and lavender lime moisturizer. The exercise room was adequate with a treadmill, stair machine, elliptical, all-purpose weight machine and free weight equipment. The fireplace by the pool is nice to sit by at night. We did not use the pool because the weather was cool. Complimentary wine hour was available from 5:30 to 6:30 where white and red wine are served next to the lobby area. West restaurant turned out to be much better than I expected. Menu items were creative and beautifully presented. Expect to pay $15 and up per entree for dinner. We thought the food was worth it. I like their appetizer "braised pork", Loup de Mer (entree: seabass with small round-cut potato). Internet and parking were free. Overall the valet service was very efficient with a few instances where the wait was more than 5 minutes due to high occupancy one night. We met the manager and hotel chef Mathew Woolfe. Both are very nice. Overall, I think free internet, free parking, complimentary wine hour, clean room and complimentary shuttle make up for its location.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Ecperience”
Reviews.Author: drdon555
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the Angeleno. Everything was spot on from valet to restaurant. Checked in a bit early and they were very accommodating even though they were fairly busy. Held my bags and sent me upstairs to the restaurant bar area and treated me to a drink (great view) and before I had finished my room was ready. Room was nice and clean and smelled fantastic, really enjoyed the stay. I was alone on business but would stay here again with my wife and go to the Getty which is pretty close (saw signs).

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, chic and clean hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Renbob
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent recommended Hotel Angeleno to us and it has been a pleasure to stay here. The staff were friendly, rooms were clean and spacious and the restaurant had delicious food. The one downfall was the location. If you do not have a car I would not recommend staying here as the public transport system in LA is poor and taxi cost a fortune. We spent more money on taxi's then anything else. And not to mention most taxi drivers were rude or would try and take us on the longest route to places. In saying this though the hotel is exceptional on servie and cleanliness and made the hotel stay enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “If you wan't peace and quiet, don't stay here.”
Reviews.Author: erinautical
Reviews.Content: We had a terrible visit at this hotel and will never stay there again. Pros: Close to UCLA; close to Manny's Pizzeria, which delivers, and has fabulous food. Con's: 1. VERY NOISY. It is sandwiched between Sunset Blvd. and the 405 freeway. If you want to open the window you have to listen to traffic. 2. Customer service was inconsistent. When I called and asked for a feather free room, I was told it wasn't a problem at all. Booked the room. When I arrived a week later after having surgery, the lady at the front desk acted as if I was speaking another language. First I was told they can only remove the feather bedding from certain rooms, and my room wasn't one of them. Then she put me in a room right over the freeway. I requested to move rooms, got a slightly quieter room, but she would not have the feathers removed. I finally stayed in the room and consequently woke up with surgery pain and a massive sinus headache. Yet, when I checked out, they couldn't understand why I wasn't given what I requested. 3. The restaurant was VERY EXPENSIVE. The buffet breakfast didn't exist, and you had to drive to go anywhere else. 4. The refrigerator in the room is jam packed with alcohol and drinks, leaving you no where to put your own refrigerated items. Overall, I would not stay here again. It was noisy, costly, and not family friendly.

Reviews.Title: “It is no Kimpton”
Reviews.Author: JG166
Reviews.Content: This hotel chain says it rivals Kimpton. Not even close! The Kimpton service is great and these folks just couldn't care less (except the head bell guy- he should manage the place). Our room was OK and the parking service was very slow. We had breakfast in the restaurant. The views are great! The food was fine and there is lots of it.

Reviews.Title: “Two nite stay”
Reviews.Author: jeffsoo1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated on its own in the middle of a major road junction, and it would be difficult to walk anywhere from it. That said it was clean and well run, with a small pool and cafe serving drinks and snacks. On the 17th floor with amazing views of the main highway back towards down town LA. The food served here was of an excellent standard.

Reviews.Title: “Crazy Convenient. But…”
Reviews.Author: Silent Crow
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Angeleno is one of those Los Angeles landmarks that everyone who has ever commuted on the 405 knows by sight. Few, however, know what the hotel is called. Most just refer to it as “that circle building that used to be the Holiday Inn.” For business convenience, it can’t be beat. It’s right on the 405, with crazy easy access to, well, pretty much every business district in LA, save Burbank. The hotel is lovely, and the parking is free for guests. The people are very nice in the lobby, the restaurant and everywhere else on the property. Extremely accommodating. The best part is the balcony off every single room; one of the most obvious ways to make a hotel more enjoyable. The downsides to the Angeleno are limited, though you best be aware of them before you book a room:1. Though convenient, it does stink to be ON America’s most popular commuting freeway. It’s as if you’re in an island surrounded by traffic noise. Not terribly inviting to take a stroll. 2. The walls are not particularly sound proof. Were you the unfortunate neighbor of a snorer or an amorous couple, you’ll either need to don your ear plugs or open your sliding door to the drowning properties of traffic noise. 3. The restaurant is fine. Fine as in “passable” for a Joie de Vivre property. Not stellar, or even especially anything, other than high above the 405. I have stayed there numerous times, and I will return… on those trips to Los Angeles that require my presence all over town over a few days.

Reviews.Title: “4 girls "HILLS" moment”
Reviews.Author: jessica A
Reviews.Content: Had a fabulous girls get-a-way here last week.!!!! Upon arrival I was greet by the nicest valets on earth and we all know how valets can be, Nelson greet us and helped us in. Jowwer ( i think is his name) checked us in and gave us the run down of the place and even offered to help us with our bags. First time anyone has ever offered to do that at a hotel. Oh yeah best part was he was always saying Hi and welcoming all of us! The room are small but AHmazing view of as the locals say "LA" ask for any room 14 or 15 on a higher floor. Yeah it over the freeway but what did you expect ?!?!?! Coffee maker in the bathroom odd but cute. Its like Japan where they had to maximize space. When time came for dinner we called down and got Jose or Josh on the phone and asked for recommendations. Josh asked what we liked what we were looking for and without even thinking twice he found the perfect restaurant, "Katsuya" but he said to go to the Hollywood one NOT the one close to the hotel. AND OMFG it was like I was on "THE HILLS" the music the people it couldn't get any better. As for the hotel itself, will need some redoing soon. All was good but the vintage (and not the cute kind) AC was on its last leg. The rooms are good but OLD. Also more plugs in the bathroom is needed 4 girls 2 outlets... grrrrr! I didn't mention this to the front desk but I'm pretty sure they know as all the other guests have said here on TA! Umm what else oh wine hour was good and the cocktails in WEST are good the black dahlia might be my new fave drink!!!!! FAB property and cute front desk boys! Ha we even named them "joWoWer" and joshy" Love the Angeleno boys........ and maybe the hotel. JK

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great view, great service”
Reviews.Author: PepperRoss
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and had a room on the 12th floor facing northwest. We had asked to be away from the I-405 side to avoid the noise. You could still hear it a bit in our room, but it was so constant that it didn’t bother us. We didn’t even use the ear plugs that we had brought. The service was great. We were traveling for 10 days and we had a fair amount of clothing, so we needed more hangers. We had barely hung up the phone from our call to housekeeping when someone arrived with a dozen more hangers! We also had a problem with a slow drain in the shower. We had explained that it was not a major problem, but a maintenance person was there within 10 minutes to repair it. We also loved the restaurant on the 17th floor. We ate breakfast there twice. The view is incredible. One day was quite stormy and it was interesting to watch the clouds float across the LA Basin. Another plus (as others have mentioned) is the free valet parking. If we called ahead, our car was always waiting by the time we took the elevator downstairs. This is a great, reasonably priced property for those looking to stay in the West LA/Santa Monica area.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: EMILYRODNY
Reviews.Content: Ive visited LA many times and, this is another location I wouldnt hesitate to stay. Yes, It is on the 405 (where there is always notorious LA traffic) but, the grounds are clean, trendy and well groomed. Free parking for hotel guest and an extremely helpful staff. The beds were extremely comfortable with high count linens. I suggest getting a low level room facing the pool. There is less noise and you are able to utilize the baclony a bit more. I Highly suggest getting breakfast (from room service) It was amazingly fresh and delicious!!! What keeps this property from being a 5 star aside from the noise on the 405 is the bathroom. If you are staying with someone you are not comfortable with, than your in trouble. There is no door for the sink/vanity area and the door for the tub/toilet is pretty clear. You can hear and see 60% of whats going on in there (sounds funny, but its TRUE lol) I was traveling with a work collegue and we had to get aquainted pretty fast for our 3 night/4day stay. Finally, yes this isnt close to "all things hollywoof" you MUST rent a car while in LA - there is NO WAY AROUND IT. This hotel having free parking is a gem compared to staying in West Hollywood where valet is 30$ a night!!! 15 mins from We.HO - 10 from Santa Monica Peir. This is a great hotel. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: Patricia B
Reviews.Content: Was there 3 days on business. Great room, super comfortable bed, very clean and incredible views. Their restaurant's bonus is that wonderful view of Los Angeles! Loved it and priced right.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the Getty Centre”
Reviews.Author: bluenoser53
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Angeleno recently expressly to visit the Getty, and from that point of view it would be hard to beat. Yes, the traffic noise is inescapable, at least if you are on the east side of the building overlooking Interstate 405, but on the other hand, the views of the city are quite outstanding from an upper floor. Through Booking.com we had requested a room on the west side, which would presumably give a view of the Pacific and be a lot quieter, but to no avail. The staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful: two calls to the desk regarding problems with the television had someone at the door literally within two minutes, and they were promptly dealt with. At dinner in the restaurant the manager stopped to chat and, on hearing that we were going to the Getty the next day, he went off and arranged shuttle transport both ways for us. The next night we were taken to Westwood Village, so the car never left the garage, where the parking is (quite exceptionally for California in my experience) free. The shuttle is also free, but it is advisable to reserve in advance to ensure availability. Both dinner and breakfast were very good, and we would have no reservations about returning to the Angeleno if we were in the area again.

Reviews.Title: “Full service and even have an on site body shop!”
Reviews.Author: rmushadisright
Reviews.Content: My wife and I moved here after transferring from the Marina Del Rey Hotel (located in the city of the same name). That hotel was dismal and we ended up making last minute reservations at the Angeleno. We arrived at the hotel before they received our reservations from Travelocity but they just confirmed the reservation through my email and immediately accommodated us. Everyone was really friendly and the checkout process was easy. The rooms are smaller but nice. It is louder if you have a room facing the 405 but we're from Chicago so the noise lulls us to sleep. The room was very clean as well as are the entire grounds. Everyone we came across was happy and eager to help. During our trip I hit a trailer with my rental car which tore part of the bumper off of it and left the fender completely black (on a white car). It appeared to need repainting. On our last day there one of the valet employees asked what I did and I told him. About 20 minutes later I come out to get the car, he pulls it up, gets out and says "it took me a little bit but I got it". Confused, I asked him what he got. He signals me to come over and he had buffed out the entire fender, leaving behind just a few minor scratches from the accident. The rental company didn't even notice that the car had been in an accident. I felt bad because I only had $5 to tip the valet but we'll get him the next time around. That was really cool and he didn't have to do that. That said, my biggest gripe with hotels like these is valet parking. I'm in and out plenty throughout the day and even though parking is free, you have to tip the valet drivers on each dropoff/ pickup. Not that I don't want to tip them. They should be tipped but when you're in/ out 5 - 6 times a day it ends up not only being more expensive than most hotel's self park fees but also more inconvenient. The hotel has a decent size parking lot out back that could easily accommodate self parking for those who desire. I wish that was something they offered, even at a nominal fee. Overall though, great hotel. It's clean, it's modern, the employees are accommodating and it's just an overall good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but location next to freeway terrible”
Reviews.Author: tburns10
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a few friends for a girls trip and we had an OK stay. The hotel itself if very modern and stylish. The beds were comfortable and the restaurant was good. Our room had a cute little balcony but due to the freeway being right next to the hotel, it was impossible to use it with all the freeway noise. Another thing we didn't like is there is there is nothing around it and if you want to walk anywhere, you can't.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great location”
Reviews.Author: Royalcot
Reviews.Content: It was difficult for us to pick a hotel in L.A. Fortunately we made a great choice. The rooms are nice (It's worth to pay for a room on the top floors, not only because of the views but also the bathroom is better). A car is a must but the hotel is well located on 405 so you can easily drive to points of interest: Santa Monica, Marina del Rey, Beverly Hills, Hollywood, etc. We asked for a room in the quiet side and noise was no problem at all. We slept like angels in Angeleno.

Reviews.Title: “Not really non-smoking”
Reviews.Author: Lamanchavillas
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights recently 12/22/11 and 12/23/11 We were placed in a room with feces coming up into the bathtub Hotel moved me to a different room where the connecting room had a heavy smoker. The smoker said nothing was posted in the room or lobby. We also had dinner and two of our party had what appeared to be bad food handling?? they were sick. Hotel still has no lobby or room posting about non smoking rule.

Reviews.Title: “Cute Hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: dragonhart
Reviews.Content: This is a great boutique hotel located right off the 405 freeway. Close to Westwood, Beverly Hills and Santa Monica.Very nice rooms with comfortable beds. There is a nice pool area with an outdoor fireplace. They have a bar and lounge on the top floor with a pretty cool view, but it does get busy at night time. Front desk staff and all the other employees were amazing, very helpful and welcoming. My wife and I only stayed there for one night but we do plan on going back.

Reviews.Title: “Californian, not Angeleno”
Reviews.Author: Wandering_Bukanin
Reviews.Content: LA, based on my brie experience, is largely flat plains of tract housing with strips of retail in between. To the north are Hollywood Hills, and nestling at the base of them; bordered by Sunset Boulevard and the '405' freeway is the Hotel Angeleno. The area around the hotel is pretty much Los Angeles standard (freeways and construction), but that only increases the pleasure of arriving. Everything is ordered, quiet, elegant and efficient. That's it really. If you want to spend your honeymoon here, don't (it's no place for romantic walks): but if you need to visit UCLA, are looking to tour the city and area, taking a special someone for a quiet weekend locked in your hotel room with each other it is perfect. The restaurant is lovely, the staff are lovely, the facilities are great and, for some reason completely unknown to me, there is a ritual glass of sparkling wine in the restaurant at sunset (honest). Enjoyed my time there very much.

Reviews.Title: “Cute modern boutique hotel conveniently/ annoying close to the 405”
Reviews.Author: msdrannie1
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Comfy beds, decent sized rooms, good service, nice toiletries..... But it is right by the 405... Which makes it convenient. But also very noisy! Would stay here again but would ask for a room on a higher floor....

Reviews.Title: “no complaints, nice, clean”
Reviews.Author: heidi c
Reviews.Content: Great location near Beverly Hills/West Hollywood. Nice and clean with wine hour in the evening for free wine. Valet only (free, minus tip) for parking. Would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: RONALD U
Reviews.Content: I have had the pleasure of staying at the Hotel Angeleno on several occasions. I have always found the service to be outstanding. The staff is always pleasant and helpful. In particular, a woman at the front desk named Edith has always been friendly, accommodating, and courteous whenever I have needed assistance. The rooms are always clean and neat. The Hotel is centrally located with Los Angeles Airport just a few minutes south of the hotel. I highly recommend the Hotel Angeleno. Ron

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, lots of highway noise”
Reviews.Author: fred200099
Reviews.Content: I very much liked this hotel except.... The service was exquisite including the happy hour reception in the lobby, the check-in staff (they also readily printed my airline boarding pass), the parking lot staff, the lobby snack bar staff, and the top floor restaurant service (evening hors d'oeuvres at the bar as well as several breakfasts were taste treats). The room was modern and comfy. I was on the seventh floor facing the freeway and the noise was continuous and loud; it sounded like the window was wide open even though everything was closed. I tuned it out and coded it as "white noise" but this kind of traffic noise all day and night would definitely be a problem for some visitors. This is not like the noise of a little bit of city traffic in a downtown hotel in NYC or Paris during the morning rush - it was a constant high decibel roar. The freeway wraps around the hotel so it is not clear that there is a quiet side. My hotel status is with Marriott points so I may not have received the best/quietest room. The workout room was very limited (one of each of about three exercise machines) and the pool was for soaking, not for laps. Nothing seemed to be within walking distance. This hotel is convenient for access to UCLA but the "W" and others are as close and don't have the noise problem.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the Hotel Angeleno!”
Reviews.Author: SKrajinovic
Reviews.Content: My husband and I planned a jam packed trip to LA with shows and visits to all that LA has to offer. We rented a car and realized parking could be anywhere from $25-$40 a day ++. So our goal was to find a nice modern hotel (at least 3 star , preferably 4 star) close to everything. The Hotel Angeleno did not diappoint. The close proximety to the highway was both a plus and a minus..Great to hop on in a jiffy so we could get to all the places we needed to go to. Not so great the first day when we woke up at 8 am in the morning to construction (not the hotels fault-city work on the highway). Upon request we were moved by the staff to a higher floor (key if you want to minimize the noise from all the cars. Also we were moved to the other side (the side with a lovely v iew of the Getty museum). In a nutshell here are some more reasons i would go back to the hotel Angeleno. -very comfy beds! -pleasing modern decor with cute little balconies with nice views. -excellent pleasent staff -free internet (we did not ecperience slow internet, so perhaps this problem is solved. -FREE PARKING!!!!! (just need to tip the valets). -handy restaturant in the hotel with a lovely ambience, view and decent food! We will definitely be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Small but comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: cds_SanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: This was a work trip in Santa Monica the first week of Nov 2011. The location worked well for us, and the price fit our project budget, better than anything actually in Santa Monica. The beds were very comfortable (I travel a lot, and this means a lot to me). We had 2 king rooms for 3 people in our group. Though I prefer to self park, the free valet parking worked out alright. We were able to get rooms on the "quiet side" and I had paid a bit more to get rooms on higher floors. There is definitely some traffic noise, but we didn't find it problematic with the door closed. The restaurant had just changed it's menu, and we had a great, (though expensive) meal there our first night. We went back one other night, and while it was good, it wasn't as great of an experience as the first time. The views from there, and the decor are both excellent. There is construction in the area, but it didn't cause us too much trouble, given that we were commuting down Sunset Blvd toward the Ocean. I would stay there again if I had work in that area.

Reviews.Title: “A very very nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: happyhlos
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels i have stayed in. The room was wonderful the bed was comfy, the bar at the top of the hotel has a great view, you must try there New York steak it is out of this world. the staff were very helpful, they would look up on how we could get to places as we didnot have a car but the bus stop is right outside and we had no trouble getting anywere.

Reviews.Title: “Bring earplugs and enjoy the savings”
Reviews.Author: FilmDave
Reviews.Content: The management of this hotel wisely has priced the property well below the neighboring hotels because of one major factor: noise. The hotel is attractive and has been well kept up for being more than 40 years old; however, it sits only a few yards from the busiest freeway in California. There is street noise at all times of the day. And, for the next two months, there is additional noise because of freeway construction across the street. The hotel is not in a convenient location for anything other than visiting UCLA, seeing the Getty or visiting friends near by. You must have a car and there are no shops to walk to. I have stayed at the hotel twice before because it is a bargain; but, this last week, will be my last. I couldn't sleep because of the excessive noise. I come to LA a few times a year and will try another place that is not on top of a freeway. On the plus side, the rooms are clean and the staff is very friendly. The hotel breakfast is expensive but tastes good.

Reviews.Title: “Poor location, useless internet”
Reviews.Author: aroundtheuniverse
Reviews.Content: These rooms needs to refurbished and unless UCLA is why you come to LA - find another location, even if the quality of that hotel is simpler than this.

Reviews.Title: “Most lovely bed”
Reviews.Author: Ashlandbuck
Reviews.Content: What a comfortable pillow-top bed, your choice of many pillows, smooth sheets. The freeway noise did not bother me in such a nice bed. Convenient shuttle to Getty. I guess the rooms are too small to have an easy chair with an ottoman. Just a desk chair. All three nights we were pooped so just ate dinners in the 17th floor restaurant West with great views to forever, since it rained and LA was cleared of smog. Beautiful. Our waiter at dinner, Alberto, is a charmer, as is the manager, Michael. They both worked well to please us. The lobster mac and cheese was presented with the sauce an injected foam at the table. Mmm. The Brentwood salad is fresh and delicious. Pumpkin soup superb. We had a fun domestic cheese plate and charcuterie with martinis to start. The Little Gem (a delicate small lettuce) was clobbered by an overbearing vinegrette and cracklings that just melted the tender leaves. The kohlrabi with chestnuts was no good at all. The young chef, from London, is taking risks, perhaps with ingredients with which he is not that familiar. Michael and Alberto made up for it. My gripe is with the Joie de Vivre Hotels slim selection of TV channels. They are for guys. Just ESPN, CNN and that stuff. no fun.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel if you can handle the freeway noise”
Reviews.Author: DenMilo
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Hotel Angeleno for Parents' Weekend at UCLA. The hotel was everything that I expected from a property in the Joie de Vivre chain...excellent staff who are very efficient, well trained, polite and helpful; well appointed rooms (very, very comfortable bed and pillows!!), a nice restaurant and lounge, nice pool, etc... My biggest negative was that because the hotel is right next to the 405...one of the busiest freeways in the country, there was constant freeway noise all night long. So, if you are a sound sleeper, I would highly recommend this hotel. Also, plan on driving everywhere. The hotel is really not conveniently located close to any restaurants, etc. Because we were there for Parents' Weekend, our activities were all based at UCLA and Westwood, so it was fine. However, I probably would not choose this hotel for a weekend getaway due to location.

Reviews.Title: “Great place in LA”
Reviews.Author: jodeaton
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience at Hotel Angeleno! The service was fabulous from the moment we walked in the lobby. Josef was so helpful with the check in process and making us comfortable. The room was lovely in modern style. The restaurant had a beautiful view and great food. The shuttle and driver to UCLA were easy and so helpful. There was construction going on in neighborhood but all the other positives made the trip excellent and I will stay whenever I go to LA!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but wifi very slow!”
Reviews.Author: Ottawop
Reviews.Content: Just a couple of points that I have not noticed on here... (1) Wireless internet speed is VERY slow. Too slow to Skype or Google Call, and actually very cumbersome to surf beyond absolute necessities. Stayed here for 3 nights, used a number of speed test sites and always came up with less than 1 Mbps speed wifi network each of the 3 days. To make things worse, there was no wifi at all for a few hours one evening. (2) Very strong smell of tobacco smoke in the hallways (property is 100% smoke-free), for better part of a full day. Did alert the front desk early in the day, not sure if they followed up. Not the hotels fault, but hopefully they crack down on this kind of stuff quickly. (3) In the land of 'car is king', this hotel is perfectly located right off the interstate for easy access to anywhere (except during rush hour when you can walk as fast as you drive) (4) Complementary wine in the evenings is really nice, though don't expect a social scene, guests generally drink a glass or two in their own corner, then head back up or out...

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel!”
Reviews.Author: adrianmix
Reviews.Content: What can I say? I had a WONDERFUL stay at the Angeleno hotel in Brentwood, CA. Check in took less than 5 minutes. The front desk folks were always willing to help, displayed a positive attitude at all times and also very efficient. My room faced the I-405 but I still had a good sleep at night...not noisy at all even with the ongoing construction/refurbishment works right outside the hotel. Rooms are very clean and bed is SO comfy. Restaurant on the 17th floor was perfect for breakfast...not a wide variety of options in the menu but I am not a big eater so it worked for me. Manager's reception in the evenings was a very nice to have feature -- free wine and good conversation with other guests. Hotel location was good since it was a short ride from customer's site and Santa Monica pier/Venice Beach are just a 25 minutes ride from the hotel. WestHo and Rodeo Drive are not far from the hotel either but you NEED to have a car for sure. Overall, had a nice stay at the Angeleno and would recommend it to anyone who gets to visit the area on business or leisure.

Reviews.Title: “All-round fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Jan D
Reviews.Content: We had an awful journey due to rush hour traffic and the reception and staff and valets/ porters were great, really helpful, kind and understanding. We phoned as we were lost and were given instructions how to get there. Rooms were lovely, comfortable beds and loads of bath and coffee/tea bits and pieces. Beautiful towels. Good size rooms. Very clean. It is next door to the (very busy) freeway but we did not have a problem with noise. The restaurant and bar are at the top of the hotel with marvellous views over LA. Food was smashing, particularly Eggs Benedict for breakfast and very good value. Great duo singing and playing in the evening. Lovely ambience. Staff throughout were exceptional, saving up to go again as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Ruined Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Mark A
Reviews.Content: Weekend Front Manager is horrible! Very Rude Guy! i will never come back to this hotel or even suggest it to people. So, inpatient. Just because you're having a bad day you don't have to bring it to your work Pal, and are you kidding me?!!! the valley parking guy sleeping on the sofa?!!! we waited for our car out in the cold because this guy is snoring his time away?!!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Customer Service with missing bag”
Reviews.Author: Ian H
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hotel Angeleno for a couple of nights before heading to LAX for my flight home. On arrival at the airport I realised I had left my jacket in the hotel, containing my car keys and other valuables. I called the hotel and Laurence (the lost property manager?) incredibly kindly and unexpectedly offered to drive the jacket to LAX and drop it off to me there. With a hour before my flight left he made it down in time and handed it to me. This was the most unexpected, thoughtful experience I've ever had at a hotel. Thanks so much. Ian

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, but painfully slow internet and noisy”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl93
Reviews.Content: Typical of a Joie de Vivre hotel, the rooms look great. Comfortable bed, lovely bath amenities. However, the "free" wireless internet is painfully slow - I wasn't trying to stream movies or anything, just check my email, and it took forever. As others have mentioned, you do hear outside noise - which you can drown out if you turn on the fan/AC in your room (so loud!). Also, no tea in the room (just coffee). Free valet parking is a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Lights are on but Nobody is home!”
Reviews.Author: alee48
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely facility in a good location but unfortunatly the staff is entirely incompetent. Those working in the lobby don't know what is going on in the rooms or at the restaurant on the 17th floor. Likewise the Food and Beverage Manager does not even know what her own website says about their hours of operation and her staff give out wrong information if you try to make a reservation. When confronted with these issues, and guests who must go to bed hungry, she is rude and arrogant. Upon checkout the frontdesk couldn't even care if anything went wrong with the stay. I have visited this facility twice and got the same uncaring treatment from the staff, especially at West restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, solid value”
Reviews.Author: Spokesman
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here 6-7 times over the past few years. Location just off 405 at Sunset is convenient to Getty Museum, Santa Monica, UCLA...just be sure to get a room that doesn't face the highway. Price is verry good on most days and parking has been free. The restaurant and bar at the top isn't the best, not is the "business center," but both will do in a pinch. I've always found the staff to be friendly and eager to help. That's a big plus for me when I'm on the road.

Reviews.Title: “Pathetic Internet”
Reviews.Author: internetrequired
Reviews.Content: Terrible wireless internet makes business use almost impossible - otherwise good but sorry - poor internet means big problems with flight bookings , email etc - It's 2011 guys - wise up! If you fix the internet problems you get above average.

Reviews.Title: “Pros and Cons”
Reviews.Author: paulasween
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a great location to visit UCLA or the Getty Museum. It is nicely appointed and the staff were very helpful and pleasant. The hotel offers convenient shuttle service to several places including UCLA and the Getty and other places as well. There was complimentary valet parking also but there really really is no place else to park. Nice pool area and good fitness center. The restaurant in the penthouse offers great views and the food is quite good if a little high in price. The breakfast portions were extremely generous and good coffee. Breakfast is NOT included in the room price. Here's the con -- there is a lot of traffic noise. We were on the 6th floor and the noise was bad and interfered with sleep. The air conditioner and fan were also quite noisy which would have helped blot out the traffic noise but they would not stay on and kept going on and off so that also interfered with sleep. Maybe the traffic noise is not as bad on the very high floors.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a base”
Reviews.Author: PeanutbutterUk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights as part of an organised tour of California. As other reviewers have said, the hotel is right next to the 405 so expect some traffic noise. However, I had a room around the other side of the building and whilst I could still hear the traffic I slept well. The hotel bar & restaurant are relatively expensive ($10 for a vodka & coke) but the food was lovely. As we were on a coach tour & due to the location of the hotel we had no choice but to eat here, although I would recommend booking a table for dinner as soon as possible - one night there was no availability until 10pm and we ended up eating in the bar, which was fine until a band started playing and killed all conversation (unnecessarily loud!). Room was great, 2 beds to pick from and free wireless internet access. Overall a good base for exploring LA.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: johnk317
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in Brentwood right on the 405 Freeway. Has a good restaurant on the top floor and free valet parking which is unheard of in LA. Rooms are clean but small, adequate for a short stay. Pool is small and claustrophobic. All in all a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Average Experience”
Reviews.Author: BKKandKSK
Reviews.Content: Am wrapping up a 5 day stay at the Angeleno for a nearby business meeting. In general, I had expected more from the hote. The Good Initial check in was great--front desk was helpful, kind and efficient. Valet (at no charge) was helpful as well. The hotel is freeway close so it is really easy to drive to whatever your heart desires in LA. View from the bar on the 17th floor was lovely. The Bad Service standards were very inconsistent. The valets were great! The front desk, not so much...On three occasions, I went to the front desk to ask for help mailing two cards. The first person suggested that if I wanted a stamp, I could get into my car and drive to a nearby market that was (at that hour) closed. The second person said that she didn't know if there were stamps and would have to ask the manager. The third person accepted my letters but wouldn't commit to mailing them. In fact, she wanted my room number in case she couldn't. In all cases, I offered to buy the stamps--I didn't expect a freebie. If the manager is reading this, I hope that he or she decided to empower his staff to offer to spend a dollar to provide good service to a guest. Room was tiny but clean and comfortable. Flat screen TV was nice. Curious that there was no newspaper delivered to my room. Maybe this was because I was there as part of a group and this was not included in the rate. The Ugly... When other reviewers have suggested that this hotel is freeway close, it is virtually on the freeway. If you have any problems with noise at night, please bring earplugs. It's pretty loud!! All in all, I wouldn't stay here again as there are multiple other options in the area for nearby meetings.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: Richard-Ipswich
Reviews.Content: Hotel Angeleno is located fairly centrally for most of LA. It’s by Highway 405 where Sunset Blvd crosses it. You can see the hotel from the highway from quite a distance because of its distinctive round tower shape. Access is pretty easy from any direction but 405 is very busy much of the day and a tad daunting after a long drive from Vegas. Arriving at the hotel for a two night stay we found free valet parking, with drop-off right outside the lobby. Check-in was pleasant and the young lady seemed genuinely interested in making sure we knew where everything was. She also invited us to a free wine reception that evening. The hotel layout is slightly unusual because of the round tower construction. Our room was pleasant but it did have an un-aired smell on arrival. It wasn’t a huge room but quite big enough. It had a nice desk and a big comfortable bed. The bathroom was quite adequate too. The room also had a small balcony but it was too small to be of any real use apart from taking a quick look at the view. If you have children in the room then you definitely don’t want them out there. In the room were a coffee maker, mini-bar, iron, hair dryer, safe and the other usual bits and pieces. There was also free wifi Internet, though no wired access. We went down to the lobby for a couple of glasses of complementary wine, which was nice. Slightly more social people than us might have chatted to some other guests and made new friends. We used the time to wander around with our wine and check out the pool area. It seemed nice, with lots of places to relax and the pool was large enough for a short swim. There’s also a fitness suite. We ate in the top-floor restaurant and it was very good. I had a shellfish medley dish that was excellent. The wine was good too. The view is out over the highway and on to downtown LA. We also ate breakfast here and that was good too. There were a few minor niggles during our stay: Tea seems to be a scarce resource here. There is none in the room and when I called the lobby for some they said I couldn’t have any. Room service carefully gave out one tea bag and even the restaurant only provided one teabag with breakfast. My wife continued to insist there was a stale smell to the room and/or towels during our stay, though I couldn’t detect it. The hotel’s location is great for driving to somewhere but there is nothing at all within walking distance. In summary, the Angeleno is a good hotel and we enjoyed our stay. However there wasn’t really anything that stood out enough to tempt us back again.

Reviews.Title: “If the Hotel Angeleno is anything like the excellent customer service I received over the phone... we've got it made!!!”
Reviews.Author: trip41143
Reviews.Content: In anticipation of our first trip to LA, I made reservations at the Hotel Angeleno for November, 2011. I called to speak with the concierge regarding any & all activities my family would be interested in, knowing we were going to have to hit the ground running on our whirlwind 3 day trip! I was literally astounded at the superior customer service I received from the hotel's greatest asset, a sweetheart of a gem, Knicole!! She was like a member of our family looking out for our best interest with all the activities we wanted to do! She thoroughly reviewed all the tours the hotel offers in detail, specialty restaurants , off the beaten path eccentric places, sites where the locals go, investigated the LA Laker's schedule, Michael Jackson things to do, etc., etc.. It is rare to find this exceptional customer service anywhere these days! I hope that Knicole's managers, Scott Gordon & Rick Gluth, value this outstanding employee and that they will share this with Knicole. If the Hotel Angeleno is anything like the excellent customer service I received over the phone...we've got it made!!! Thank You and I look forward to staying at the Hotel Angeleno and meeting Knicole in November! Sincerely, T. Miranda ***Please note I was unable to submit without a date. Nov 2011 was not available, so I was forced to choose Nov 2010.***

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Mike L
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my two teenage sons and found it terrific. It's is a convenient location and while it is right off the freeway and can be noisy at the pool, in your room you do not hear a thing. In addition to the free, friendly valet service, we also requested a microwave and a small fridge which there was no charge for. The hotel is hip but warm. Staff was great and for the price, a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and Great location”
Reviews.Author: Lathrops
Reviews.Content: The rooms and beds are so wonderful, great luxury and wonderfully relaxing. Dinner at the West in the hotel was very good. Just a few minutes away from Santa Monica and ocean!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible. Stay somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: BryceQ
Reviews.Content: Many of the hotels in LA were either fully booked or ridiculously expensive the week I needed to go there. I booked a room at the Hotel Angeleno through Hotwire because I got a good price for a 3 1/2 star hotel. Overall my stay was somewhere between poor and really bad. The service was terrible - my room when I checked in was missing several things (coffee maker (but coffee was there), ice bucket, room service menu, etc.). It took me 45 minutes and three attempts to get a room service menu so I could order dinner. When I went back to the hotel the second night after work the coffee maker and ice bucket were gone and I had to have them brought to the room again for the second day in a row. The room service food was not very well cooked and was not very warm when it got to me. My small room was so close to the 405 that it felt like my bed was in the middle of the highway. The air conditioner was insanely loud and didn't cool very well. The hotel location is terrible. There is nothing nearby and the 405 makes access a pain in the neck. Needless to say, I will not be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very disapointed!”
Reviews.Author: Fabianars
Reviews.Content: Very desapointed about it. I stayed there for a week last month and i would never do it again. To make a long story short I can say: this place is a kingdom of dust, with rock pillows in a tiny room!

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and clean hotel but not in a very good location!”
Reviews.Author: maryglover
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and spent over 300 dollars in cab fares!! We were told there was a courtsey bus for hotel guests but the staff were less than helpful when we enquired about it. Our overall impression was of a clean and comfortable hotel on the edge of a very busy road junction!!! Would not consider staying here again but due to the location rather than anything else.

Reviews.Title: “Great location just a drive away from Santa Monica...”
Reviews.Author: laurensof
Reviews.Content: Everything was exceptional except the air conditioner was noisy! Immaculately clean and big spacious rooms w amazing beds and fab bathrooms. I would stay again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: longislandfreddie
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed 2 nights here well appointed hotel . Position not so great right next to freeway but for 2 nights ok. the king bed was comfy except it dipped in the middle so we kept rolling onto one another ( may not bother some people!) Our 7 year old slept on rolla way bed should have gone for a room with 2 doubles as it was a tight squeeze. But over all good hotel ALL staff lovely and friendly and helpful which makes a big difference .

Reviews.Title: “Love Hotel Angeleno!”
Reviews.Author: allornothingirl
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times, and I have been more than pleased with each experience. The staff is beyond kind and helpful, from answering any questions I might have, to suggesting ways to take advantage of hotel amenities, to helping me book the 'perfect" room. The valet service is prompt and friendly. Of course it is mandatory valet and it is somewhat pricey, but that seems to be the norm for most LA hotels. The rooms are great, very comfy, have everything you might need, and don't overstock with things you don't. The beds are comfortable and linens are white and clean. Bathrooms are nice, if slightly small. In-room coffee maker, hair dryer, bath products, extra towels, mini-bar items, etc are all as expected. Some rooms have a tub and others a shower only, so if you're a soaker just make sure to mention that when reserving a room. Every room I have stayed in has a balcony and that is something I absolutely LOVE in a hotel - the weather in LA is one if its best selling points and being able to enjoy that while in room is a definite luxury. The restaurant on the top floor of the hotel, West, is amazing. The waitstaff and sommelier were all very knowledgeable and helpful, and suggested some amazing pairings I never would have known to try. The food is fresh and delicious and expertly prepared. I ended up having almost a custom meal, just because I was willing to ask questions and try different options. I even got a complimentary breakfast sent to my room after dining there the evening before, just to thank me for being a happy customer. Now that is pretty awesome service if you ask me. All in all, JDV properties rarely disappoint and Hotel Angeleno is no exception. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and will definitely be back myself.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service & Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Rocky786
Reviews.Content: I have been a regular visitor to this hotel for the past 2 years. I had an excellent stay at Hotel Angeleno (near Sunset Blvd/I-405) and enjoyed superior customer service. The hotel is very prompt in addressing any issues quickly and promptly. If You are JDV member, there's always a bottle of wine waiting in your room. Hotel Prices are reasonable. They have a great restaurant on the 17th floor with panaromic views of the city. Special thanks to Lesly, Tiffanie and entire staff !!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CrazyforNawlins
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Angeleno Father's Day weekend June 2011. The hotel is quite stylish and clean. The service was very good. Unfortunately the noise level is through the roof. I requested a high floor opposite the 405 freeway. I did receive a room on the tenth floor and somewhat away from the 405 but still heard the traffic noise. Once you open your balcony door all you hear is the rush of traffic and its constant. The pool area is very nice and so is fthe fitness center. You definitely need a car to get around. If you don't mind the noise or having to travel to popular spots then this hotel is a keeper.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and fun.”
Reviews.Author: bythemoon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for six days (it was my second time there) and didn't want to leave. It has a smart and contemporary design, and the circular arrangement of the building makes for an interesting layout. The beds are divinely comfortable and the bathrooms are well-stocked with spa-style bath products. The pool area is lovely by day (or by night), and there is a fine restaurant and bar (with live music some nights) on the top floor. The view of Bel Air, Brentwood, and the stream of lights on the 405 is awesome at night. Parking was free during my stay, which made this hotel a good value for the L.A. area. Be aware that the hotel is right off the 405, so if you're concerned about highway noise, bring ear plugs . . . I wasn't bothered by it. It's true that the hotel is not in the midst of concentrated attractions, but you are well-poised here to head in any direction you choose, whether it's Beverly Hills/Hollywood or Santa Monica. Of special note is the proximity of the fabulous Getty Center, which you can reach with the assistance of the free hotel shuttle. My only regret is that the hotel is no longer lit up at night by the beautiful blue lights that made it such a stunner, but I understand that was quashed by neighbors bothered by the bright display. Nonetheless, still a lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great rate in great location”
Reviews.Author: JuliaLaJolla
Reviews.Content: We stayed just one night prior to visiting the Getty Center. The hotel is relatively inexpensive for this part of the LA area and it is about a mile from the Getty. Our room on the 14th floor faced the freeway, but we were not bothered by noise, and it was kind of fun to watch the rush hour traffic while sipping our red wine amenity. The restaurant West was very pleasant for dinner, and breakfast there was good.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location, lovely room”
Reviews.Author: imissneworleans
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with 2 teenaged boys, sightseeing in Los Angeles. I picked it for the excellent location and was not disappointed. The room, a bit small as it is an old Holiday Inn, was clean, crisply decorated, conveniently appointed and elegant. I loved it. The pool is nice, too. I would recommend this hotel for sightseeing and for business because of its location right on the 405 at Sunset Blvd.

Reviews.Title: “Small, strange and understaffed. But the price was right.”
Reviews.Author: sslambie67
Reviews.Content: With sleek decor in the lobby and some of the trappings of a nice boutique hotel, it gives a good first impression. As time goes on, the hotel begins to feel as though it is part of a movie set and is not actually run by trained employees. The rooms are decent, but small. A narrow armoire serves as a "closet," so storage space was limited. The bathroom was divided oddly into two sections, sink area and toilet/shower. But the door to the toilet/shower area is glass and very see-through. There is no door between the bedroom and the bathroom entry where the sink is. Therefore, there is no privacy at all. Among the 8 of us staying at the Angeleno that weekend, we all agreed that was a very strange design choice and made things awkward. Not everyone sharing rooms is on such an intimate level with their travel partner that using the toilet behind glass should feel natural. We called for room service and it rang indefinitely. Many menu items were not available. Pool towels were mysteriously missing one day, and no one was around to fetch them. The poor woman in the coffee shop was our go-to person for everything, and she barely knew how to run the coffee shop. Many coffee items on the menu seemed beyond her capability. Ingredients had run out or were not available. The smoothie mixer was broken, or required mix that they didn't have on hand. The one place where things work well is the valet station. Those guys run a good operation, which can be tricky at the intersection of Sunset, the 405 and Church Street under repair. Bravo to those guys who bring the cars up and down. They are always there, always friendly. If you stay there, ask for a room on the side facing away from the highway. The noise is very loud. Staying higher up in the building might help also, but then you contend with the super slow elevators. We tended to use the stairs since we were on Level 6. The beds are comfortable, with nice clean linens. That is worth a lot in my book! In general the room was clean. The location is convenient to Westwood, Brentwood, Palisades, and parts of Santa Monica. Beverly Hills is not too far, although traffic made it slow. Despite all of my observations being pretty critical, I have hope that the kinks can be worked out. I hope the Joie de Vivre company reads guest reviews. For the reasonable rate, I would be willing to try it again. It is hard to find 2 adjoining rooms in LA for under $400/night, and that's what we had.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: TiburonTony
Reviews.Content: We have patronized a number of Joie de Vivre hotels and this is the most upscale, with a full service restaurant. The building itself looks a little incongruous being in a cylindrical configuration and is in somewhat of a no man's land. However, it is well served for road access being next door to entry and exit ramps for I405 (there is construction at the interchange which effects traffic patterns, and one ramp is closed at nights). The room was above average size with a comfortable king bed, work desk, full length closet and a mini bar / refrigerator. There was both WiFi and Ethernet complimentary broadband access in the room; the WiFi was satisfactory but I couldn't get the Ethernet to connect. The desk surface was large enough to be able to work comfortably on. Although there were numerous power outlets in the room few of them were convenient to the desk. There was only one useful outlet close to the desk, near the floor. Under the desk there was an additional outlet but hidden behind a rats nest of communication wiring. We ended up with devices on the bedside table and in the bathroom in order to charge them. The bathroom was large with a single sink, toilet and shower. The shower was a walk-in type and looked as if it could have been converted from a tub configuration. Water pressure and temperature was good. Lighting was fluorescent but was adequate. The room provided an ironing board and iron, a safe (which I didn't' use), hair dryer and a coffee maker. The room overlooked I405, noise from which was discernible at night but not uncomfortably so. The air conditioning unit was more obtrusive, largely I think because I don't travel much any longer and so I'm unused to an AC unit. The staff were accommodating, pleasant and efficient, Parking is complimentary but requires the use of a valet service, we never waited more than two minutes for our car. Unlike other Joie de Vivre hotels we have stayed in breakfast is not complimentary. One can either use the restaurant or they have a cafe with muffins and croissants. We didn't partake of breakfast at the hotel so I cannot comment, although the cafe offerings didn't look particularly inspiring. We eat dinner at the hotel one night and it was excellent, much better than usual hotel restaurant fare and it was reasonably priced. Another surprise was that it was busy. Although the hotel is somewhat isolated from services such as shops and restaurants, Brentwood Village is 0.6 miles down Sunset Blvd. and there is a sidewalk between the hotel and the village for anyone wanting a little exercise. In the village there is an excellent restaurant (Divino) and a cafe (Lu Pan Quotidian), also excellent and both worth visiting. Overall I'd highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really liked this hotel, but there were a few problems”
Reviews.Author: SFgirlSF
Reviews.Content: All the amenities were excellent at this hotel. The restaurant on the top floor has a wonderful view and the food was excellent. The room was clean and comfortable and they had complementary wine in the lobby in the evening. My room was not near the freeway, so I did not have a problem with freeway noise, but some of my colleagues were not so fortunate. Sometimes the front desk would not answer their phone. We tried to call for the free shuttle to come pick us up, but nobody answered the phone for over half an hour. This happened twice in the week we were there. The internet was ridiculously slow. Also, the fire alarm went off in the middle of the night.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: Feelinbeachy43
Reviews.Content: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this hotel. The staff was great (thank you Tiffanie for the Mother's Day brunch recommendations) and the hotel is right where you need to be (although a car is still a must). The pool area is very relaxing and the rooftop lounge has awesome views. Yes, the hotel is located right off the highway so it does get a very noisy, but it didn't keep us up at night. If you are light sleeper - ask for a room on the other side of the building and you should be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, reasonable room and hotel prices”
Reviews.Author: DanielleButton
Reviews.Content: We had a minor issue when we first arrived in that we requested a king bed and only had what appeared to be just smaller than a double, we complianed and got moved no problem. I didnt notice any noice, i was on the other side of the hotel to the freeway. The restaurant upstairs had a great view and was suprisingly reasonably priced. All staff were fantastic bit one gentlemen on the front desk in particular who's name i think was Jose but really can't remember now. He couldnt be helpful enough for which we were very grateful. I would stay here again only i would prefer to be a little closer and in walking distance to restaurants etc. Although to compensate the hotel offers a free shuttle to anywhere within 1 mile radius of the hotel to take you to restaurants etc.

Reviews.Title: “Best Customer Service I have ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: Salvosisters
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a decent 4 star standard and good value for money. Customer service at this hotel was the best I have ever experienced, and I am a high-maintenance hotel guest! If you have a car and don't feel the need to be walking distance to restaurants etc, this hotel is a great option. Thanks to all the staff who served us during our stay - the great service made such a difference

Reviews.Title: “Base camp for exploring”
Reviews.Author: charmedsisters
Reviews.Content: Myself and 2 sisters stayed here from 21st-24th April 2011, It took around 20 mins by taxi from LAX airport costing around $40, on the return to the airport we took the hotel shuttle bus to UCLA where we got the flybus back costing just $5 and they run every 30 mins, it dropped us off right outside departures. The hotel do offer a free shuttle bus within a 3 mile radius but has to be booked in advance with reception. A bus stop is situated across the road from the hotel costing $1.50 for most routes (ask reception for timetable) the only downside is that there is no where to walk out to for a meal or drink, they do have a resturant on the 17th floor with great views but has a limited menu and we found expensive. One night after a very long day out Jorge on reception arranged for us to have food delivered in. Lesly on reception was brilliant and went above and beyond to help us with anything and everything, she helped make our stay more enjoyable. The beds we found to be very comfy but we had a room facing the freeway and was very noisy. Overall we enjoyed our stay and would recomend a short stay here. Many thanks to Lesly (who felt like our new best friend) from The Charmed girls, UKxxxxxx

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: nyyanks
Reviews.Content: My fiancé, my mom, and I were attending a wedding a nearby hotel and much of the wedding party was staying at the Angeleno because of its close proximity to the wedding location. I remembered this property as the old Holiday Inn from all the years living in LA. Prior to arriving I was offer an "upgrade" if available for an additional $10. I figured I would accept this as it was only $10. When I arrived I found out that my $10 upgrade got me exactly 1 floor higher than my mother’s room and the exact same view…its $10, I’m not going to complain! When we arrived, I found out that they only had valet parking which I am accustomed to. However, when the valet attendant tells me to park the car it that spot myself I question as to why they even have valet. The check in process was smooth and it’s always nice when your room is ready upon check in. Since we were there for a wedding, there was supposed to be a welcome envelope/gift waiting for us at the front desk which naturally they could not find. My mom’s room was being paid for by the bride’s parents but the front desk still had her place a credit card down for incidentals. Having worked in the hotel business for 12 years, I knew that she was going to be charged for the room as well so I was adamant that it was just for incidentals and the front desk agent said it was. The room was small but nice. The TV was extremely fussy and when I called down to the front desk I was told that that was the way all the TVs were in the hotel which I found out was a lie since I went down to my mom’s room and the picture was crystal clear. The bathroom was small and the shower had no door which led to a nice flooding situation every time we showered. The following morning we asked for a 3 extra sets of towels since we had used most of them the night before getting ready for the wedding. They sent up 2 wash cloths and it took another 30 minutes to get the other towels sent up. While driving back home that day we received a call from the mother of the bride wanting to know why we were not at the brunch that morning. We explained that we knew nothing about it. Of course it was in the gift basket that was at the front desk that they could not find when we checked it but miraculously turned up after was had departed. I almost forgot, as I had expected, my mom’s credit card was charged for the room. I will never stay there again…it might look like a boutique hotel, but it’s still run like a Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Very well situated but extremely noisy”
Reviews.Author: JMR007
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel during three days... With a very good location (near ucla and beberly hills), the hotel is close to a freeway and is extremely noisy.. really, there are sometimes that you cannot hear the tv. I asked for a quite room and the only solution was to give me an earplug (!) The room had some bad details like the tv didnt work, old furniture, shower really bad,... And last two days the elevator didnt work so we spent more time waiting the elevator that in the room... Las day tried to use the business center for a meeting and they didnt allow us to close the door... amazing...

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Angeleno is close to everything cool about LA-Hollywood, Beverly Hills, Santa Monica, and The Getty.”
Reviews.Author: suejj14
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Angeleno provides exemplary service in a trendy setting. It's host to a fine dining restaurant with a view from the very top floor. I stayed three nights this past weekend and dined at the West for breakfast and a couple dinners. Let me say, the food is fresh and flavorful, and very satisfying. The hotel service is very good. The staff are very welcoming, and after a day of seeing the sights nothing beats relaxing with a glass of pinot noir in the lobby or by the outdoor fireplace, gratis daily. They provide shuttle service to The Getty, and when my plans changed to return to the hotel early the driver was waiting by the time I made my way to the exit. One of the valet staff wrote out directions for me to a local landmark Mexican restaurant, taking the time to provide that extra touch. I noticed some freeway noise in my room but not enough to keep me awake. There is some construction work on the freeway nearby, but it should be cleared up soon. I would return to stay at this hotel because of the great service.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Angeleno- Modern, nice and for a reasonable price!”
Reviews.Author: 5_Star_Holly
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Angeleno for four nights which was one of the only 4 stars hotels in Los Angeles that was both reasonably priced, modern and easy to find. The hotel is circular in architecture and right off Sunset Blvd. and the 405 highway, which is both a positive and negative. As long as you request a room on a high floor facing away from the freeway, you can have a lovely view of the hills and even the pacific ocean in the far distance. We stayed in room 1503 and were quite pleased with our room and view for the price paid ($125 a night). On the 17th floor is a great restaurant that has wonderful views of the entire city and has a great Bloody Mary brunch on Sundays. Although there aren't any restaurants within walking distance, the hotel does offer a complementary shuttle that will take you anywhere within a 3 mile radius. We loved going to nearby Westwood village near the UCLA campus for In-N-Out burgers and fun sports bars like Barney's beanery (1037 Broxton Ave) that serves breakfast all day and has at least 30 televisions! Overall, a nice stay for a reasonable price!

Reviews.Title: “Won't be returning back: feels like you're sleeping on the highway and the service is poor.”
Reviews.Author: joellehaddad
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to spending 5 nights at the Angeleno but was utterly disappointed for the following reasons: 1. Noisy rooms due to proximity of highway and non-double glazed windows 2. Without prior notice or knocking, someone came into our room and abruptly exited when they discovered we were in the room. I flagged it 3 times with front desk but eventhough they said they will check and revert, no one did 3. Front desk could not answer any of our queries and kept transferring us to someone else who also failed to answer our queries - specifically Internet problems we were having

Reviews.Title: “Very accommodating accommodations with a fab view, friendly staff & yummy room service”
Reviews.Author: Shea15
Reviews.Content: Even from the start, I was the difficult one. I'm very friendly, but I want what I want. I asked one of the managers, Arika, could I please have a microwave in my room for the eight days duration since I would be nuking my blueberry tea w/non-fat milk multiple times per day; and six extra pillows please. No problem! Since I was there for a leisure visit with my son, the UCLA rocket scientist student, I had a crazy schedule and their housekeeping staff was wonderful about the odd hours. I've stayed at many places, and usually room service cannot be bragged about, but theirs was practically better then the restaurant itself who concocted it. I was impressed. Just in general, any request, was answered or met pleasantly. I felt like part of the family or staff upon leaving. Valet was very nice too. All personnel made it a point to greet and inquire respectfully-that includes the elevator repairman and "lobby wine host." And the beds were insanely comfortable-a pillow top-which I had never experienced. The front desk supplied the name of the manufacturer and I bought one upon return to Las Vegas. Crazy huh? My back issues are much less of an issue now thanks to Hotel Angeleno. You know, sometimes I had the bar make my special cocktail recipe, and they were easy about the request. Matter of fact, sometimes I brought in my own cocktail to the restaurant (it's made with fresh watermelon juice which is rarely available) and no one gave it a glance. I told you...difficult. It was just a stress-free, fun visit. Of course, I would adore less expensive room rates (who doesn't) and maybe some rock and roll piped in because jazz just isn't my cup of tea, but I didn't even have to complain at all.

Reviews.Title: “Service from the hotel staff was above and beyond expectations!”
Reviews.Author: DSedcole
Reviews.Content: This hotel just delivered and delivered excellent service to my family during our week's stay in Los Angeles. They quickly changed our room on check in to best suit our needs. The room service was prompt and delicious. The front desk staff was very friendly, as was the valet - especially the AM/day crew - they payed special attention to our toddler, and he couldn't wait to say, "Hi" and see them each morning. The bed was one of THE most comfortable I've ever slept in. Housekeeping was so friendly and did a great job in our room. My family wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. Of special note, I had left some fine jewelry in the safe (including a family diamond pendant) and Anna, head of housekeeping, and her staff returned it to me safely. Talk about honestly and exceeding expectations. I am so lucky these ladies took care of us. Thank you - thank you Anna! You are the best.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: barbiecar
Reviews.Content: I have stayed twice at the Hotel Angeleno and I love this hotel. The service is stellar as well as the comfort of the rooms. I am very picky about the beds so when I say the bed is comfy it is comfy...The hotel features an amazing restaurant that has a dazzeling view of the city. They also have a great shuttle that will take you the Getty, West Wood, or even UCLA Medical Center. Wonderful Wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Not So Pleased”
Reviews.Author: CarolS52
Reviews.Content: The beds were very comfortable and the staff very friendly. The valet service was courteous, fast, and efficient. Inviting outdoor pool. Small but functional fitness room. The best breakfast waffles! That said, the hotel is surrounded by high traffic which is very noisy. Forget using the balcony (which is just large enough for two people to stand on). The noise is intolerable once you open the sliding doors, which you want to do because the rooms are small and stuffy. Three people in a room with luggage and you're tripping over each other. No room for the suitcases, and the wardrobe is too small. We hope they'll do something in the wash area concerning the lighting. If you're a woman (or man) and trying to put on make-up, bring a lighted mirror. No full length mirror, either! That's bad when you're dressing for a formal event. And the TV blocks the mirror behind the bureau. Our party was sharing two rooms. Both ran out of tissues and toilet paper which weren't replaced, even after the tissue box was turned upside down so that the room attendant would take note. Also, our rooms went unmade for an entire day until we let it be known we had to start getting ready for the evening's events. To top it off, the restaurant is super expensive with few menu selections. At lunch, we brought in a tiny cake to surprise and acknowledge a family member's birthday and were asked to pay a $10.00 fee. Outrageous! But, the breakfast waffles are fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “...great hotel...terrific service, amenities and a wonderful restaurant...”
Reviews.Author: bslosky
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at Hotel Angeleno for approximately five years, ever since I discovered it. Location in Brentwood, only minutes from Westwood and Bel Air...and Beverly Hills and Santa Monica, make it ideal for me. Great pool, work-out room, and one of the best restaurants in LA. Front-desk staff have always been extremely helpful...and, Edith, in particular, who seems to know all the great places to visit, has a Google-map ready, whenever I mention where I'm going, has made my stay as stress-free and easy as one could want. Bill Slosky St. Thomas and Pompano Beach, Fl.

Reviews.Title: “Fun!”
Reviews.Author: Gypsytraveler09
Reviews.Content: I can remember seeing this round tower since childhood whenever we would drive down the 405. For me, it signals all of the best known Southern California sights are right around the corner. So yes, staying here was on the bucket list. So much for the prologue. My new BF and I took an old school chum to the Cake concert at The Troubadour for his birthday and since neither of them had been through Malibu we drove down the coast on highway 1 and stopped at my favorite breakfast burrito place, Lilly's at Point Dume, then came down Sunset. Turns out that the hotel I thought I had reserved had NO record of my reservation. Which was fine. I popped in to The Angeleno and got a double room for the night and was pleasantly surprised to find that the rate was still pretty cheap for a 3 day weekend (double under $200). The room was clean and modern. I loved the restaurant/bar on the 17th floor which has a great view. I wish that I had brought a swim suit, because the pool looked pretty inviting. I want to return and I think that I have found my new favorite place to stay. It is central to the freeways and museums that I frequent and is only a few minutes away from the best shopping and nightlife in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem Near Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: swtnpetite
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to visit the Hotel Angeleno during All-Star Weekend. The staff was extremely pleasant and the Valet attendants were extremely helpful. They are the first people that you see when you arrive and the first impression is imperative. It was raining all weekend and they had an umbrella for the ladies at all times. The rooms were immaculate! I travel often, and the cleanliness makes the trip sooooo much better. I had a room that faced I-405 and I was not fazed by the traffic. A friend and I experience the bar and it's a lovely atmosphere. I was expecting to pay for valet at the end of my stay, but to my surprise it was complimentary. Great Perk! It's only minutes from Hollywood and I'll recommend this to any of my friends wishing to travel to Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Attentive but not Intrusive”
Reviews.Author: markroy53
Reviews.Content: this was our first joie de vivre property that we stayed in in california. the locations is convenient to the getty museum and the interstate. the restaurant was excellent and the breakfast waffles "to die for". the staff was superb. when they knew that we were on our honeymoon they comped us chocolate covered strawberries and a nice california white wine. edith at the reception requires special mention for her helpfulness and courtesy.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice, friendly and helpful staff is a must”
Reviews.Author: 30_Countries
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my wife. The location is not the best in LA, but it compensates with a great staff and good rooms. I wanted to book some tours in LA and the front desk people were extremely helpful and friendly. Also, I saw some reviews talking about the sounds from the highway and I have to say that I didn´t listen anything, had great nights of sleep there. The restaurant in the top floor is good, service quite slow, but good. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy but nice”
Reviews.Author: DavidPMessingham
Reviews.Content: We had three nights at the Angeleno & found it to be as good as anywhere else. The staff are extremely friendly & very helpful. Jorge on the desk was particularly helpful with lots of good advice regarding day trips, we took his advice & enjoyed all the trips. The top floor restaurant is top quality if a little expensive however this does keep the clientel a little above the fast food munchers. The food is perfectly cooked, presented & served. The hotel does run a free mini bus to a nearby shopping centre which is usefull as there is nowhere near the hotel to get any day to day needs. That is the only drawback as it is surrounded by freeways, major roads & dual carriageways. This is a problem if you want to go for a walk as there is nowhere you can safely go. We wanted to walk to the Getty museum & gallery that we could see from our room which I would estimate was about 10 minutes away but we were strongly advised to get a taxi as it would be too dangerous to walk. Then off course with all this traffic there is a lot of noise even with all the windows shut etc', I strongly recommend you take ear plugs & use them. We enjoyed our stay at the Angeleno & would stay there again and take our earplugs!
