Reviews.Title: “clean, comfortable, fun. overall good location but right off the freeway.”
Reviews.Author: ivyc
Reviews.Content: nice pool, room and friendly compitent staff. it is too close to the freeway, but in a great part of LA. The price made it competely worth it. don't be afraid of the freeway.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - but their Accounts system is a mess, beware with your Credit Cards!!”
Reviews.Author: DurbanTraceyL
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in August, great hotel, lovely rooms and facilities BUT its located right on the highway which is never mentioned anywhere, cant walk anywhere, have to catch a cab. I had great things to say about this hotel until now - 3 months AFTER my stay, they have debited, credited and generally Messed up my account. My credit cards have now been blocked (as I reported fraudulent activity) and my accounts have been frozen leaving me in a really bad situation. Their accounts system is a mess and SA Bank policy is 45 days now to sort out this dispute before I will have access to MY money again. I am Furious!

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: Ebonycello
Reviews.Content: It was actually october 2009, there was no date in the list, not gonna say too much in case they put the price up!! a great hotel, the staff are lovely and it was very reasonably priced, a great place to explore the rest of LA,will be back

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: dlcausby
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Angeleno was incredible. I've stayed in other hotels in the LA area, but the Angeleno was exceptional. First of all, the location is PERFECT. I will stay there from now on for this reason alone. Secondly, the service of the staff and the quality of the rooms is as high as any other hotel in the area. And lastly, the view from the restaurant on the 17th floor is amazing; dinner along with the sunset is nothing less than spectacular. Give it a shot, you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Nice rooms, Amazing value”
Reviews.Author: torontojjc
Reviews.Content: right in the heart of west LA. there was a complementary shuttle to any location within 2 miles of the hotel. the beds were amazing, proper duvets not the typical thin homeless shelter blankets that you find at other hotels. the hotel was extremely cheap im guessing because it is right on the highway, but i found this very convenient and didnt bother me in the least. rooms were clean, and the decor was very impressive.

Reviews.Title: “This was in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: lorieart
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and comfortable. Housekeeping was very good as was the friendliness in the restaurant. The food on the 17th floor was excellent. The woman at the desk, whose name tag said Edith, was very friendly and helpful. The valet service people were also very friendly. The only suggestion for improvement would be that it would have been helpful to have a luggage rack in the room.

Reviews.Title: “very nice and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: unerusse
Reviews.Content: Hotel Angeleno is a very modern and comfortable hotel, decorated in a contemporary style. Location is not the best - it is right off the highway, but the hotel itself is quite nice. I especially liked the hotel restaurant on the top floor. The restaurant is highly recommended! Food is much better than you would expect in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great find in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: NYC9263
Reviews.Content: The Angeleno hotel was perfectly located as a base during my most recent trip to Los Angeles. Just off the 405 at Sunset Blvd, it was convenient for me to get to all areas of the city. I was worried that it might be noisy, but it wasn't -- not even at rush hour. The rooms were pretty and the common areas were, too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: lpb1Cheshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights as part of a touring holiday. We loved the hotel, it was clean, comfortable, functional with everything you could need. The bed was very comfortable and the room had a little balcony that allowed you to open the patio doors. It did overlook the freeway but we were not really bothered by noise. It was central for all the sight seeing we wanted to do. We liked: - the roof top restaurant - the food was good and the view fantastic -the complimentary glass of wine in the evening -the small pool area with cheery outside fire in the evenings -the service -free wifi. Slight negatives were there were no other restaurants to walk to in the area and the valet parking was quite expensive (tho' efficient). It cost nearly 6 dollars for a bottle of water in the ground floor cafe. I had emailed the hotel before hand to request a low floor room and this was all ready when we arrived. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraRM
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, clean, comfortable. I am always greeted with smiles from all on premises from the moment the Valet takes my car, and I walk to the friendly, attractive, smiling Front Desk staff, especially Lesly & Edith. The housekeeping staff, and all the employees in the wonderful restaurant West are friendly and efficient. This hotel never disappoints! The most comfortable bed & linens ever, and I travel quite often. This place is special and they make me feel special when I stay there. I would never stay anywhere else in Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooms, but noisy traffic”
Reviews.Author: mm9876
Reviews.Content: Our room was on the 10th floor of the 17 floor hotel and it was pretty noisy throughout the night due to constant traffic on the freeway. The hotel was located just off the freeway and we were a little disappointed to find out on arrival that we had to pay $20 per day for valet parking, even though the car park was joined onto the hotel - we hadnt been warned of this in advance and were staying 3 nights. The hotel rooms were very lovely and it had a really nice pool but the hotel bar and restaurant was a little pretentious and the service not great.

Reviews.Title: “The best botique hotel in los angeles”
Reviews.Author: pinkynsmuv
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect and the staff really seemed to care . No complaints and I will definitly stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Stay at Hotel Angeleno”
Reviews.Author: MrandMrsMonkeyhead
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was right off the freeway and within 20 minutes of everything we wanted to do in LA. It was very easy to find and the front desk was very helpful with everything. The rooms were very clean and organized. We were on the 14th floor and it had a great view of the city at night. The room we stayed in had a desk that was great to work on as well as a great shower to relax in at the end of the day. The overall atmosphere was wonderful. We wish the place had a hot tub or spa as it only had a pool. Paying for parking at a hotel your already paying a high price for was a little frustrating. Also, the price to use the computer was a little more than expected.

Reviews.Title: “Reserved For The Location”
Reviews.Author: srugnetta
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for myself and other east coast business associates for its location. While the hotel was clean, safe, and comfortable it lacked what east coast business travelers require. Coffee is not available until 6:30am. You can walk i mile up Sunset to the Starbucks which opens at 5:30. The hotel lacks a quiet location for business discussions. I placed a 5:00am wake-up call so I could make my east coast flight. The wake up call never came. I woke up 45 minutes after the desire time and rushed for my flight home. You get the picture. This is not a business centric hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: grm1897
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay at the Hotel Angeleno. I had previously stayed here many years ago when it was a Holiday Inn. This is a great hotel and I really enjoyed my stay. My room was immaculate with a great view, comfortable bed and nice bathroom. Everything very clean in my room as well as all over the hotel. The outdoor pool area is the best. You could not ask for much better. I had a nice dinner in the restaurant with the best view. All staff very friendly!! I would definitely stay here again. Thank you Hotel Angeleno.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for UCLA parents”
Reviews.Author: gyslaine72
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights during UCLA orientation. Great location, rooms and amenities. Staff was extremely helpful. I really enjoyed jogging to Brentwood village for breakfast in the morning. We got a great deal through priceline and would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: collegecuti
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I visited LA for a friend's wedding and stayed at the Hotel Angeleno. My fiance and I enjoyed the pool area, and the fitness center. The coffee shop was convenient, and the restaurant was fantastic with great service. The front desk staff was very friendly: Ericka and Brynn were a great help. Overall, we were very pleased with the Hotel Angeleno. We will go back the next time we are in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, middle of nowhere”
Reviews.Author: CarlaS23
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with 2 friends for 3 nights in July. Our travel agent booked it for us. It was a nice hotel, the rooms were fine and the pool area was good. The problem is that it is in the middle of nowhere. They have a shuttle bus that can take you to places nearby but even the places nearby arn't that great. I think if you have a car or are staying for business then it would be no problem. I would choose elsewhere if you are on holidays because we ended up spending a lot of money on getting around. Having said that, the staff were really nice, we had no problems with service. We certaintly still had a great time in LA but I would probably look around elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Call Home”
Reviews.Author: hoosiertreker
Reviews.Content: My husband and 11 -ear-old spent five nights of our LA-area vacation at the Hotel Angeleno. The place had a bit of the hip, boutique vibe. But, it was also large enough to meet our needs for comfort, cleanliness, knowledgeable staff etc. The room with two double beds was pretty small for three people for five nights. I ran into a family of four who had booked the same room type for five days as well. We were both happy with the hotel, but pressed for space. The public areas were stylish. The pool was heated and the fireplace was a great place to sit outside on chilly evenings. The location is a little strange because it is right on the highway -- away from other hotels, returants and attractions. But, a five minute drive to Westwood or Brentwood was easy. Plus, Beverly Hills was close as well. The reviewers that described the rooms as loud from traffic noise must have been sleeping with the door open. It was really loud outside on the balcony, but I couldn't even hear it in the room. They did a great job soundproofing the glass. While on this same trip we spent one night at the Sheraton Universal, I suspect these buildings were buit at about the same time. But, the remodel of the Hotel Angeleno was far superior. They paid attention to all of the interior details. For example, the bathroom doors didn't have 15 layers of paint like a lot of older hotels do. They proabaly completely gutted the interior because the finishes were all neat and fresh. If you have concerns about older hotels like I do, you will not have any concerns with the interior of The Hotel Angeleno. With the AAA rate, we payed an average of $150 per night. Not bad for LA.

Reviews.Title: “Great location if you have business at UCLA”
Reviews.Author: Beaverfan62
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over a long weekend to be with family and a convocation at UCLA. Great location for so many things....only traveled on the freeway once....to get back to LAX!!

Reviews.Title: “My home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: DebraTravels88
Reviews.Content: Hotel Angeleno offers a convenient location for my business trips to Los Angeles as it has easy access to the 405 freeway and Sunset Boulevard. I visit Los Angeles quite often and have stayed at many of the city's hotels. My first choice is always the Hotel Angeleno because I can depend on clean and comfortable rooms with a view of the city or the Getty Museum. The staff is courteous and service oriented and they really make it feel like a home away from home to me. It has a great lounge and restaurant so I don't need to drive to dine. I can't think of a better place to stay given the amenities and the price for a boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel with the friendliest staff I have ever encountered.”
Reviews.Author: jpowell_chapelhill
Reviews.Content: I can not say enough about the customer service at the Hotel Angeleno. I have been a regular guest for a couple years and could not ask for a better experience each and every visit. The staff is friendly, efficient and greats you by name after only one introduction. Edith, at the front desk, takes such good care of me I feel like she is family. It is clear the staff loves their job and truly care about the experience of each guest. The rooms are cozy with very comfortable beds and pillows. The pool area is gorgeous with an outdoor fireplace for evening enjoyment.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Angeleno's guest care is beyond excellence.”
Reviews.Author: Juls775
Reviews.Content: My company has been sending our team members to stay at the Hotel Angeleno since April 2008. All of your staff there is attentive and accommodating, but Edith's guest care is beyond excellence. She always ensures our hotel arrangements are in the system, greets us with a smile, remembers our names and what we do for our company. Edith always makes me and my team members feel at home when we stay there with extra special touches and attention to detail. It is because of Edith and the amazing service that we stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Freeway hotel”
Reviews.Author: afywaevr
Reviews.Content: As mentioned by many people before, this hotel doesn't have an ideal location due to its being right by the freeway. However the noise isn't unbearable provided that you keep the windows shut; a shame since every room has a small balcony, but you just wouldn't feel like standing out there since the view isn't breathtaking either. The rooms are what you expect from a classic American hotel, ie. clean and comfortable. I would basically recommend this hotel of you're in LA/Santa Monica on business ad don't mind spending a lot of time driving around.

Reviews.Title: “Classy little place.”
Reviews.Author: glegh
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel. Rooms were not large, but nicely done - very comfortable bed! Freeway noise was certainly there, but didn't bother our sleep at all. Great people working at the hotel - valet parking is really nice! Well worth the price of $20.00/d. Perfect location for our needs - Santa Monica, Pacific Pallisades, UCLA, the Hills etc. The swimming lessons were a bit of a bother, for sure. Overall, a classy little hotel with great service.

Reviews.Title: “Sleeping on a free way”
Reviews.Author: lnewco
Reviews.Content: If you would like to try sleeping on a free way do not hesitate book this hotel. You will never able to sleep or rest from noise that is coming from the free ways that surround this hotel. Walls are not sound proof and I doubt that any other rooms would be free of constant noise. The rooms are small and dungy. I felt like running away from it each time the morning came and not to come back until very late in the evening. I also had a problem checking in. When booked the hotel was promised a room at 12 p.m. as with any decent places would be expected. My checking in was delayed until 3 p.m. at which point I was not offered a room to go thru my luggage in order to change. The front desk clerk pointed at the bathroom where you suppose to unpack on a dirty floor. All of that was very much not to my liking and didn't make me very uncomfortable using anything else in that hotel other then purchased 2 bottles of mineral water in their shop for which I did not get a receipt being explained that under the amount of $20.00 they do not provide a receipt????? I will never stay there again or recommend it to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent front desk and staff, fabulous food and comfy beds! I'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: GirlGoneMild
Reviews.Content: From the moment I walked into the Hotel Angeleno, I loved it! Great artwork on the walls, clean and charming lobby area, the vibe - chic and cool. Kelly was at the front desk to greet me immediately with a smile and assistance. I checked into my room and turned on the t.v., while waiting for my dinner reservation at WEST. Of course, I had pushed too many buttons at once on the t.v., and couldn't get my movie started, so I called downstairs and the Rooms Divison Manager, Scott, sent someone up immediately. Ben the engineer showed up within 5 minutes and fixed my issue. When was the last time you were at a hotel, got a manager on the phone and an issue was solved within 5 minutes?! I felt really good about my choice to stay at the Angeleno! Great customer service, great rate, and wait until I tell you about dinner...! I went upstairs to WEST Restaurant on the 17th floor, where I was seated by Eileen, at a table where I watched the sunset from their 180 degree views. Beautiful! Any table at WEST is really good since there are so many windows. You can see from Beverly Hills out to the beaches, it's very cool at night with all of the lights, and the bar area looks like it's out of a magazine. Our very attentive waiter made some suggestions as to what to try, (forgive me, I forgot your name, but you were so good and your service was A++++), I started with THE best caesar salad I have every had, hands down! The dressing was so yummy. Then, I had the most incredibly juicy filet (cue: mouth watering), asparagus, and for dessert (I couldn't resist!) a molten lava chocolate cake with strawberries and some ice cream. Our busboy (who I understand won "Employee of the Month") was fabulous, too. I wish I could eat like that every night!!! Such a lovely dinner, and the food and service was truly excellent. The next morning, I ordered up breakfast and asked how long it might be before it would be up to the room? I was told "30 minutes or less". Twenty minutes later, there was a knock on my door and Pedro brought in a great breakfast! Eggs, chicken apple sausage, potatoes, fruit, and a bagel, and some deeeelish fresh squeezed OJ. I sat in my comfy bed (by the way, this bed is the same as the "Heavenly" mattress and it was so cozy), ate my breakfast and enjoyed the last few hours of my stay at my new favorite LA hotel! (Did i mention the great heated pool with a fireplace outside?!) Thank you to everyone at the Hotel Angeleno who made my stay wonderful! I HIGHLY recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel.. right next to Getty”
Reviews.Author: creativetampabay
Reviews.Content: Very chic.Staff very nice.I got this hotel as a secret shopper on travelocity, so I got lucky! Nice restaurant on the top floor to view LA and beds were sooo comfortable. The gym is tiny but the pool is nice and so was the fireplace. Parking was $40 but it was worth it very nice valet guys. 5 min around the corner is subway, nice brentwood shops and a good italian restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of freeway noise”
Reviews.Author: GrahamN
Reviews.Content: The hotel is yards from the freeway, so even though I asked to change room there was no escaping the noise. It does not get quieter at night - the freeway is very busy 24/7 24 hours a day. Although the valet parking is expensive, this is the same everywhere you go in LA. I eat out twice and had to pay $6 each time for parking ($4.50 charge plus tip). I also had to pay $20 for parking in the underground car park of the offices I was visiting. With no buffet at breakfast, I found the service slow which is frustrating when you are pushed for time. I tried to check in early, and was told that there were no quieter rooms available until 3pm, only to be given at 3pm the room which must have been the closest to the freeway. I asked to change rooms, which they did. The door handle on the new room you had to push up rather than pull down. However the bill I received on checking out was $18 per day higher for the first 2 nights, and $38 for the third night. When I raised this I was told that I had been moved to an upgraded room (I could see no difference to the first room I had), but reception said nothing about extra charges when I moved room. To their credit they agreed to amend the bill to the agreed rate. However it took two receptionists twenty minutes to make the change. Luckily I was not in a hurry. I would recommend it if you are not in a hurry and don't mind traffic noise. I sat by the pool for an hour to get some sun. It is very small with very little seating and the sun disappeared at about 6pm. On the positive side they did not charge for internet access, which you only seem to get at cheaper hotels (I do not understand why). Personally I would rather have stayed in the Luxe across the road, but they had no vacancies the nights I was there.

Reviews.Title: “All by myself”
Reviews.Author: Peneech
Reviews.Content: Hi we recently stayed at the hotel angeleno also, bouyed on by the positive reviews on trip advisor and recommendation from our travel agent. I think if you had a car, and were looking for a place in between la and Santa Monica the location is ok. We were given a room that was overlooking the pool, not on the freeway side and were not really bothered by any noise. The room and hotel is well presented. Staff were ok we made good use of the shuttle, but it goes no more than 3miles. We kept getting transferred to ucla and used the hop on hop off red bus that has a stop nearby. The rooftop bar has a great view but the food and service was not befitting of such a location and was overpriced. The biggest issue was not being able to walk anywhere for amenities, coffee etc due to the hotels position. Many of the restaraunts in brentwood deliver so we took advantage of that overall for what we paid (think it worked out to under $150au a night I thought it was reasonable value

Reviews.Title: “Noise hell.”
Reviews.Author: Mamania
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Staff helpful. Noise horrendous . Breakfast a disgrace- bacon so hard broke my father's tooth. Mean portions and so expensive .

Reviews.Title: “Clean, nice, free shuttle, good neighborhood.”
Reviews.Author: Ixxo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Angeleno for a week while attending an event at the UCLA. What's best with the hotel is that they provide 'free' shuttle (nothing is really free in the USA) to close-by locations such as Westwood or UCLA. The hotel is virtually next to a major highway so it's noisy at all times. It didn't bother me though as I'm used to city noise... I had a nice view on Bel Air (and the highway). The room was nice and clean, the bed was pretty comfortable, there was a small balcony, there was nothing that bothered me. Staff were extremely friendly (at least according to European standards) and helpful. All of them. The only bad thing is the location in the sense of mobility. Nothing, really nothing, is within a walkable distance. Buses are pretty infrequent and it feels strange to take a bus in L.A. anyway (I felt like a weirdo). So you have to either take a taxi or have a car. They have (quite expensive I heard) valet parking. But that's L.A., it's like this everywhere. I would certainly recommend this hotel to those visiting UCLA or nearby locations where you can use the complimentary shuttle. Or if you have/rent a car.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel except for kiddie swimming lessons in pool.”
Reviews.Author: dcinca
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the hotel except for one thing, the swim lessons being given to local children in the pool. The pool is not that big and the swim lessons and the kids waiting for their swim lessons took up most the pool.leaving little room for the guests. the room itself was nice and the bed comfortable. The $20 for valet parking does seem steep.

Reviews.Title: “Check to see if this hotel suits your needs, then you wont be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: sb1973Westsussex
Reviews.Content: Sorry for the delay in posting this review as we stayed between 19th and 22nd June. I had read the reviews about this hotel and was aware of its location before we arrived. For us we hired a car for getting around , therefore the hotels location was very central to all the tourist hotspots. Yes the hotel was right next to the freeway, but apart from a little noise i cant say this ruined our stay, although there were no "this is the view from our room photos!" The room was, as some have highlighted ,small and a little dark and dated. In hindsight i should of maybe asked if there was another room, but it was perfectly fine, clean and comfortable. The room was ready at check in. The only thing that we found was off putting was that there were swimming lessons held at the hotels pool. These lessons lasted most of the afternoon. This i know put me and another guest off from swimming as we had to avoid the lession and feel embarrassed when you over hear the children ask "coach " why were we in there!. The staff at the hotel were overall fantastic (depending who you ask, one obviously had not bothered to check on something) and go out of their way to help. I would like to mention Lesley on reception who was just amazing and really made our stay so enjoyable. (ie getting Disney dining reservations and was a font of all knowledge) The lady in the cafe area (who suggested we visited a park that she walks her dog in sorry forgot her name) We also used the WEST restaurant which was very nice.The staff especially the German manageress, who allowed us to watch the Engalnd football match over breakfast!, were all very good. All in all we enjoyed our stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room - shame about the rest”
Reviews.Author: jimevelyn
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here as part of our honeymoon tour to the USA. Before we left we had contacted the hotels we were staying at to inform them of our special occassion. This hotel had said they would pass on our details to the 'guest experience team' and they looked forward to our arrival. That was the end of that however and when we mentioned at the front desk it was our honeymoon we were congratulated only. We were not expecting anything grand but to have been sent an e- mail implying otherwise, it was a bit disappointing. We cannot fault the room as it was very comfortable and the bed was one of the comfiest we have slept in a hotel. The room and hotel overall was very clean as well. The location of his hotel is not ideal and is not withing walking distance of anything which became a pain. The hotel did lay on a complimnetary shuttle bus service which ran every half hour between the Getty Centre, and 2 local villages; Westwood and Brentwood. This bus however needed to be booked in advance, which was fair enough, however if someone else had booked in for the time you were wanting you could not also book in. The bus sat around 8 people, which didn't make sense to us as if there were a family of 4 booked it for Brentwood at 6pm then there would be 4 available seats on the bus but if we wanted to go to Brentwood at 6pm we couldn't as the bus was already booked, even although there were 4 spare seats. This was very annoying as it meant you needed to book the shuttle bus in advance the day before, but as you know on holiday you don't always know your plans that far ahead. It was necessary to go outwith the hotel for dinner and nothing was in walking distance so the options were a taxi (expensive), local buses (infrequent) or the hotel shuttle bus. On the last night of our stay we ate in the hotel restaurant as we couldn't be bothered with the hassle of going elsewhere. The menu was pricey but we went anyway and the food was lovely, couldn't fault it. Our bill came and we added it to the room with a tip to make the bill up to a round number and also left a tip on the table. When we got back to the room we checked the online account balance that you could access through the tv and the restaurant bill was $10 more than what the bill had said. My husband phoned the front desk to query and we were told that the tip WE had written on the bill was $10 more than what we had actually written in. My husband said that we had not written that amount on the bill and there was no response, This really angered us as the tip we made up on the card was to simply make the total up to a round number and we left another tip on the table. It is lucky that we could afford the extra $10 and i realise it is not alot of money, however the cheek of them adding on the extra $10 is shocking. People tip what they can afford and what they feel is adequate. Overall we probably wouldn't reccommend this hotel in L.A due the above mentioned, but we did enjoy our stay once we got used to the local bus system!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and with friendly staff. Some traffic noise.”
Reviews.Author: JontiRedmarshall
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel as a first night stopover on a fly-drive trip to the canyons. We found the hotel easily from LA airport and check in was very good - offering us a choice of rooms and suggesting one away from the freeway would be quieter for us. The room was very clean, comfortable, spacious and well presented. We used the top floor bar for an evening drink & snack and enjoyed good, friendly service. The views were enjoyable. We could hear some traffic noise during the night but we always carry ear plugs and they cancelled out the noise. Breakfast was taken in the top floor restaurant (adjacent to the bar) and again everything was very friendly and enjoyable. We didn't see a lot of LA but it seems you need a car to get anywhere in the city. A very comfortable hotel with friendly staff - what more could you want.

Reviews.Title: “There are Better Hotel Choices in LA than this Place”
Reviews.Author: Aurora100
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night recently while attending a meeting at UCLA. I was really glad that my stay was limited to one night because I really did not like this hotel at all. The room was decent, and the hotel had a fun bar on the top floor, but those are the only positives. What I didn’t like about the hotel was: The Location -. LA has a reputation as not a walker’s town. While this is true compared to a cities such as NY and Chicago, there are many part of LA that are great for walking. However, this particular location, by the 405 freeway (which I could hear and look out on from my room) in Brentwood, was not at all friendly to walkers. While the hotel did have a free shuttle that would take you to nearby places, I would say that ff you want to stay on the Westside of LA, Westwood, Century City, or Beverly Hills are much better options. Amenities – The pool and gym were really tiny. I stay in a lot of hotels, and their gym was one of the smallest I have ever seen. Key system – The worst thing about this hotel was their key system for the guest rooms. The green light on the door mechanism would turn green when I inserted my key, but the door wouldn’t open. This happened every time I used it! Furthermore, problem this wasn’t just isolated to my room. One of my co-workers had the same problem. Next time I go down to LA and have a choice of what hotel to choose, I guarantee that it will not be the Hotel Angeleno

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: JudySh
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely hotel right off the 405 making it easy to get everywhere. The hotel shuttle saved us a lot of driving time by taking us to various places within a certain radius of the hotel, i.e. Getty Museum, restaurants, etc. The rooms were furnished lovely, though some were a bit small. The service of everyone at the hotel was wonderful. We were there for my son's wedding and were given a special group rate. I would definitely recommend this hotel to people that want to be in the Los Angeles area near the Getty Museum, Skirball Cultural Center and the Westwood, Brentwood areas.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but for the price it could be a lot better.”
Reviews.Author: dalazz
Reviews.Content: Pros: nice clean rooms, nice location, nice view, good valet, comfy bed Cons: • *very* overpriced food - I've splurged on high priced meals before, but the food seems like grocery store food that's been dolled up. 2 small cookies & a glass of milk = $13 after taxes, fees & gratuity. very mediocre food.. I would suggest delivery from some of the excellent places nearby. It will be half the cost & *much* better. • HD TV's, but not HD Programming (analog stretched) • noisy, since it's on top of the 405 freeway • $20/night for parking • Valet-only parking • weird bathroom design (no locking door, sliding door only.. can't turn on the shower without getting wet.)

Reviews.Title: “Best View”
Reviews.Author: OffBroadwayPrinting
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers you the best view of LA. A 180 view from Downtown to the ocean. A friendly staff who knows your name and always ask what can they do for you. Please be sure to say hi the gang at the front desk and a special thanks to Lesley, Edith, Tiffany, Jovver. Carlos and the boys at the valet. Special thanks to my door/bag guy Brain. Enjoy your trip!!! Richard

Reviews.Title: “Comfy beds in convenient location amid highway noise”
Reviews.Author: EthanJay
Reviews.Content: I chose Hotel Angeleno for their comfy beds and they didn't disappoint - soft fabrics and nice pillows, which is the kind of setting that makes you want to stay in your hotel room all day long. However, the noise level of the highway definitely puts a damper on the experience even though there is a balcony and a nice pool downstairs (we didn't get to use the pool because the weather was unseasonably cool during our stay). Next time we would request a room NOT facing the highway (but we requested this since this was my relatives' first time in LA and they wanted to get a good view of the city). I understand that valet parking is a "L.A. thing", but the fact that every time I wanted to have access to my car, I would need to ask somebody to retrieve it for me is slightly annoying to say the least (set aside the fact that I felt like I had to tip the parking staff at least once a day when I would come in and out of the hotel 2-3 times a day). Would have been a lot easier if hotel guests had a dedicated parking area with card access (the hotel hosts a lot of "hip" local events and thus requires valet parking for those guests). Other than that the location of the hotel is right on spot - being close to Brentwood, which is one of the most exclusive neighborhoods in the COUNTRY and having close proximity to Santa Monica beach, Hollywood, and downtown. Good access to highway is very important in LA as we even ventured out to Monterey Park and Alhambra for good Chinese food. The hotel's restaurant has a surprisingly decent breakfast menu with decent prices, which is a good option if you don't feel like going out. I would be more inclined to come back if the parking fee ($18 a day) was waived or if hotel guests can have easier access to their car. Overall, still a really good experience though.

Reviews.Title: “Poor location, isolated and expensive to eat in restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Mavis186338
Reviews.Content: Hotel is well decorated and furnished but is situated on an island between the meeting of the freeways, traffic noise terrible, nothing within walking distance to see or do, the complimentary car runs only within 3 mile radius and it was out of action for one day plus you need to book car in advance, staff not very knowledgeable re local public transport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: LindyKC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a 4 day weekend to LA and stayed at Hotel Angeleno..our room was delightful, a beautiful view of the Getty Museum, and super comfortable bed! Noise was not a problem..the only downfall to the room was the shower. It didn't have a door or curtain that closed all the way, and there was always water on the floor-not to mention that I was always cold while showering... The Lounge/Restaurant on the top flooor, West, was trendy and nice, but VERY expensive. My husband and I ate breakfast there one morning, and with only one memosa each, our bill was $60! Overall, good food, and excellent drinks. West is a HOT SPOT for locals-lots of pretty people:) Location is PERFECT. A ten minute drive (traffic pending) to Santa Monica, and literally RIGHT around the corner from Beverly Hills. We had dinner one evening at Il Ciello (spelling) in Beverly Hills, and it was amazing, so romantic!! Angeleno is a two minute drive from Beverly Hills.. Roughly 15 minutes from Hollywood. Valet at Angeleno is apparently $25/night, but we were comp'd since we had just gotten married! SO NICE!! The front desk staff was so efficient in getting us whatever we wanted, even called to order pizza for us. The pool area is very SMALL. Since it was Nov/Dec, we skipped swimming, but it was a nice area, and had a beautiful fireplace. Overall, a very clean, pleasureable stay at Hotel Angeleno. We would definitely recommend to any person, any age, and will most likely stay again when returning to LA!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Angeleno is ideal for location and view.”
Reviews.Author: Gettysburg
Reviews.Content: Hotel Angeleno is a luxury hotel, located in close proximity to the J. Paul Getty Center, the purpose of our trip to LA. The hotel is circular with a wonderful restaurant at the top--the 17th floor. The staff is very cordial and very responsive to ones needs. We were so fortunate to be on the 14th floor in a beautiful suite. Since we were staying a week, we wanted a little extra room to relax and move about. The furnishings are chosen for comfort; the beds are extremely comfortable. The hotel provides complimentary shuttle service within a radius of 3 mi., so visiting the Getty Center was very convenient. The Getty Center is a "must" for anyone visiting LA. Made up of 5 museums, a beautiful garden, several restaurants, it held our attention for 3 full days.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! loved it! loved it!”
Reviews.Author: mum4boys
Reviews.Content: I cannot tell you how much I enjoyed my stay here. From the moment of check in the front desk staff were amazing, especially Christina who booked us into the fabest restaurants and gave such good advice on how to spend our time, we certainly got the most of our short stay in LA and it was all down to her. The bed was the most comfortable I have ever slept in and although it is situated by the side of the freeway it didn't cause us a problem. The views from the balcony were amazing. The general decor was very hip and trendy and I especially loved the pool area, I was in heaven lying around there. There is a nice restaurant and bar on the top floor. Hope to return one day.

Reviews.Title: “Stay spoilt by money 'going missing'”
Reviews.Author: Jono_and_Jo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Angeleno for 2 nights during a round the world trip. The location is not great if you want to be near the centre of LA, however there are plenty of restaurants in nearby Westwood. The room's are clean and quite modern and confortable. Our stay was spoilt by £300 going missing from our bag whilst they were being held in the luggage room while we waited for our transfer. We did report this to the front office manager who insisted he would conduct and investigation and inform me of the outcome. It is now nearly a month since we stayed there and I am yet to hear from the front office manager. Unfortunately I woud not reccomend this hotel to anyone as I feel you have to stay somewhere you can trust.

Reviews.Title: “Chic but relaxed hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: NatsyLondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my sister and my three nephews while we were stuck in LA due to the volcanic ash stopping flights to London. We moved here from another hotel which wasn't up to our standards. It was relief to find such a nice hotel with such reasonable rates as we coped with the unexpected cost of our unscheduled stay. The hotel is beautiful. Many things were of the standard of a five star hotel. The beds were so comfortable and the decor classy. Loved the pool area. The pool is not huge but big enough. The area around the pool is spacious and has the comfiest poolside furniture I've ever had the pleasure of relaxing on. (Shame that inconsiderate smokers flick butts down here from their balconies.) The area of LA is good but the location of the hotel isn't great if you don't have a car. There is nowhere to eat, drink or shop within walking distance. However, they hotel compensates for this by offering free shuttles. Basically like a free taxi service. Just book at the desk. The drivers were great. Friendly and can recommend places to go. I didn't have my laptop and it was a bit of a hassle to have to pay to use the computers considering other hotels we stayed at let you use them for free. You do get 15 minutes free per day but we needed to use the internet quite a bit due to our flight situation. There is a restaurant that we didn't try (it looked good though but not the stuff my nephews would eat) and there is a cafe in the lobby. This has good quality coffee and food for breakfast and lunch. The staff are one of the best things about the hotel. They are friendly and accommodating. They were very sympathetic to our situation and helped us out in any way they could.

Reviews.Title: “An Inexpensive gem”
Reviews.Author: TVRetiree
Reviews.Content: My daughter,son-in-law, granddaughter and I stayed here for five days at the beginning of April and what a surprise it was. The Staff are very special and go to great lengths to see you are satisfied. The rooms were clean and the beds are very comfortable, The restaurant is on the top floor and provides a lovely view of LA. This with the added bonus of excellent food, very good service and pleasant surroundings made dining there more than just convenient but desirable. The rates were very reasonable for such a well rounded hotel and I would not hesitate to recommend this spot to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic start to our Anniversary...”
Reviews.Author: colejohns
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 2 nights while down in LA for our anniversary before driving up the coast to Santa Barbara - we booked the hotel through Expedia as one of the "top secret hotels" so you make your reservation and once confirmed you then find out where you are staying. We were a little skeptical at first after reading some of the other reviews about the noise and out of the way location but were totally blown away from the minute we arrived. The hotel was offering free wine tasting in the lobby so after checking in we were able to sit down and relax with a glass of wine (much needed after a crazy day of traveling and the lobby furniture was actually decent – comfy sofas, pillows and club chairs). After chatting with the “wine guy” we found out that he was one of the hotel managers and after chatting with him a bit more I have to say that both my boyfriend and I felt very “at home” in the hotel. The rooms were very tidy and comfortable, the pool area can get a bit loud as they have music playing pretty much all the time but for me it was not a concern, light sleepers however may want to request a room on a higher floor. We found it to be a great location and super easy to get to and from. We have to give a huge thank you to Frankie – our valet guy – we never had to wait long for the valet but we found that Frankie was super friendly from the minute we checked in to when we checked out. His shining moment with us was when it came to dinner on our first night - there is not much in the way of restaurants around the hotel with the exception of the hotel restaurant and a gas station but Frankie was able to recommend (and got us a phone number) for an amazing Chinese restaurant that was only about a 10 minute drive away. All in all we were extremely happy and surprised with the hotel, we would definitely stay here again and recommend to anyone traveling to the area.

Reviews.Title: “Always Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: willie25
Reviews.Content: When i am in town for business, the only place i stay is the Hotel Angeleno at Sunset and the 405. Although i could say nice things about the comfortable beds, the great food at West restaurant, etc, etc, the most important thing to me is the staff. From the guys who park my care, to the front desk people to the staff in the restaurant, they are simply the best. In particular i would like to praise Edith, Christina, and Lesly at the front desk who are the main reason i keep coming back. They make you feel at home and are always there to assist you in every way.. There are other places i could stay but i always come back to the Hotel Angeleno..

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a great price”
Reviews.Author: Jerseybones64
Reviews.Content: I was very happy w/ my stay at the hotel. It was conveniently located. The rooms were clean. The valet service didn't keep me waiting for my car. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “This would be a cool hotel in 2002”
Reviews.Author: Greenlite711
Reviews.Content: This hotel is reasonably comfortable, although not very stylish or well situated. For a New Yorker who doesn't drive, the hotel's location near several bus lines was helpful, but the taxi from the airport was over $50. It is very convenient to the Getty and UCLA, however. Here are my grievances: 1. The advertised free shuttle must be booked way in advance. I was told at 9am that it would not be available until 1pm. I ended up taking the bus most days. 2. The hotel seems to rent out its pool during the days for baby swim lessons. This is bizarre and kind of ruins the experience of lounging by the pool. 3. There were no room service menus in the room when I arrived. When I called, they told me to come up to the restaurant to get a menu, since the restaurant menu is the room service menu. Room service is only available at meal times - NOT 24 hours. The fairly isolated location of the hotel means you will probably end up relying too much on the overpriced, boring restaurant. (Again, it would be very cool in the 90s.) 4. The coffee shop (the only place to buy basic snacks, water, etc.) was inexplicably closed for long periods of time, when its posted hours of operation were 6:30am - 8pm. 5. The hotel hosts pretty lame DJs on the weekends, and the noise can be annoying. All in all, I was satisfied with the hotel only because I was paying a heavily reduced rate. The free wifi is very reliable, which is a major plus for me.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient for Conference at Skirball”
Reviews.Author: schoeny2
Reviews.Content: Very nice, clean hotel. Was in town for a conference at Skirball up the road. Was very easy to access the conference. Hotel was clean, quite and had good service. Over all very pleased with the experience and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty hotel, but some security is lacking”
Reviews.Author: erinwyher
Reviews.Content: This review is for a three night stay that my husband and I had for fun and visiting relatives and friends. We arrived in LA in the morning, at around 10am, from our flight from Philadelphia in the wee hours of the morning. Because we arrived so early, I attempted to get us checked in on the early side, and the two girls at the front desk were able to get us in a little on the early side, which was nice. Over the course of our stay, the hotel seemed quite busy, with groups of individuals being toured around, and with families milling around the lobby. The lobby is quite beautifully laid out with sofas and the pool area which is quite pretty and secluded. The gym is a nice bonus to have. There is one treadmill and one or two other pieces of equipment. The treadmill has a view of the pool which was pretty cool to look out upon while I did my morning run. We had come from over a foot of snow back home in Philadelphia, and the sun we got in LA was welcome. The location is okay. It's near to UCLA, so we could hit the Whole Foods there for snacks. Word to the wise, if you value your sleep, upgrade to a room on a higher executive floor. The first night of our stay, we were awakened at 3am by partiers. My husband called down to the front desk, and let them know that some partiers were being loud. We assumed that the loud music and chatter was coming from a nearby balcony. However, after little while, we realized that the party was happening at the pool, which was 7 floors below our room. Apparently, other rooms were calling and complaining about it as well, but it was only one hour later that the party was successfully broken up. I was not able to get back to sleep that night and I was pretty mad. The front desk definitely took our complaints seriously and over the next day, we were moved to a higher, quieter room. Apparently, the party had broken out while security was unavailable and it took a while for security to return to the hotel to break it up. After my husband complained further, the next day, the manager comped the first night in the room, The room itself was gorgeous, and the staff was very attentive, but I have reservations about staying here again. If I can be assured that the hotel will be quiet at night, I'm happy. White noise is hardly a problem on the highway side of the building. The noise that travels up from the pool, in case of a "security breach" is unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: JamieHerts
Reviews.Content: It's the kind of stylish place we like and a little different to many other hotels being a circular tower with great view over LA. A special offer at the time helped keep costs down which is useful because LA is a lot more expensive than I thought it would be (the exchange rate doesn't help!). Its also worth baring in mind the parking is $20 a day . Overall we were pleased with the hotel, the room and its location. Its right next to the freeway so about 20 minutes from Century City (for shopping) and Santa Monica beaches, the Getty Museum is 5 minutes away on a hill looking down on the hotel. You must have a car otherwise its not a good place to stay, the restaurant West is a little on the expensive side but we had a belated valentines meal there and it was excellent, there is only 1 other option near by (Beverly Hills Bar and Grill, next to the petrol stations 5 minute walk). The bed is fantastic as is the shower, despite the noise from the road it doesn't disturb that much and I'm a light sleeper. The hotel leaves ear plugs next to the bed but after the 1st evening room service threw them away which seemed a strange thing to do and didn't replace them for 2 nights. A couple of tips - if you like a cocktail or glass of wine in the evening they have 50% off mon - Fri in their bar 5pm-7pm and a great place to watch the sun go down over LA, a few nights a week there is free wine in the lobby for all the guests which is a nice touch. Breakfast isn't much more expensive than we had elsewhere and worth doing at least once for the fantastic view over the city on a sunny morning.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience with Booking - Didn't Even Bother”
Reviews.Author: CelineCeline
Reviews.Content: I was planning on staying at this hotel for a few days, but encountered poor service with booking. First, got directed to reservations that asked for me to leave a voicemail. Then had to call back and the hotel booked the room for me, only didn't send me confirmation email like they said they would so I had to follow up on that. When I got the confirmation email, I had to call to confirm the rate and asked them to send me an email, only I didn't heard back for days. So I called again and they couldn't locate my reservations and I was told that I had called the central line when I should call the "in house" reservations because that's where I apparantly booked through fyi in house and central reservations for this hotel are not on the same system). So made another call only to have a really rude girl on the other line. All the while, I am being charged long distance rate because their toll free line does not work. This experience was enough for me to cancel my reservations. First impressions are everything, and I was left with a bad one.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Wine Hour, Soft Sheets!”
Reviews.Author: dimes
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night prior to flying out of LAX the next afternoon. The hotel is beautiful, well appointed, and clean. There's a cool outdoor fireplace on the main level by the pool. We enjoyed the wine hour and the house Cabernet. We spent the evening with friends and returned to see a nice view of the city. It's just off I-405, so if you have trouble sleeping - they provide ear plugs. We were above the main hotel driveway, had the a/c on, and slept like babies. The sheets were so soft, but the pillows were firm enough. They provide nice shampoo, conditioner, soap, and q-tips. The valet service ($20) was easy to use and the valets were very nice. A nice place to stay. Free wi-fi was handy.

Reviews.Title: “Five star all the way, especially a warm and caring check in by Edith !!!”
Reviews.Author: bigbuckdallas
Reviews.Content: As soon as you enter, the mode of elegance sets the tone. The check in is smooth and quick. Everyone, especially Edith, brings a warm smile to your face and makes you believe you are someone special to them. My father and I have stayed at this hotel since 1989. Anyone and everyone should stay at a hotel once in a lifetime as elegant and customer service friendly as the Angeleno Hotel. I plan to stay here for the next twenty years.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Room, Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: joethebarber
Reviews.Content: I had to travel to Los Angeles for a trade show. It was a long drive and long show but the reward was staying at a fantastic hotel. - SUPER comfortable bed. I want to know the brand name on the mattress - Beautiful, well designed room - Amazing service, from the valet to the housekeepers, all top notch - Fantastic front desk. I am looking forward to coming back to this hotel for a weekend that does not include work so I can enjoy the beautiful pool and the restaurant!

Reviews.Title: “Service was amazing along with a great hotel and central location”
Reviews.Author: Hova212
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is beautiful, the rooms are great and the location is right off of the highway. It was my first time in LA being from New York and I think this location is ideal even though there is no stores near this location I think its best because you need a car no matter what in LA. The location was a 10-15 minute drive to every location we wanted to see to get the full LA experience. We were located close to Holloywood Blvd walk of fame, Rodeo Dr., Santa Monica, Venice, Malibu, and Universal Studios. The farthest place was Downtown LA which took 40 mins to get to and the only time we experienced "LA Traffic" and thats because I went to a Laker game. Jorge Castewada and Sean Alaura were at the front desk and were very helpful during our stay providing a cake for my birthday at no charge and being very helpful with tips on clubs and resturaunts to go to at night. Me and my girlfriend are 25 years old and this place was modern chic and amazing service.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Phenomenal!!!”
Reviews.Author: mgarci06
Reviews.Content: 1. Hotel locaiton was superb Every location that we had planned to visit was a good driving distance (i.e. Universal Studios, Sunset Blvd, LAX airport, Roscoe's Chicken & Waffles, Beverly Hills, Santa Monica, Staple Center, etc). FYI: We decided to rent a car which I highly advise to any traveler. We stayed in LA for 4-5 days and the gas last us until we reached the car rental. 2. The staff were incredibly professional, helpful, kind, enthusiastic It was my boyfriend's birthday and I had called the front desk on the day of his birthday (really short notice)- they had informed me that they don't provide birthday packages, however they can provide me with a list of the restaurant's dessert. My boyfriend and I were at a Lakers game and by the time we arrived back to the hotel- there was a HUGE cake waiting for us. The staff decided to take time to go to a market and buy a cake for my boyfriend... and it was provided to us in the house (FREE)!!! Thank you to Sean Alaura and to Jorge Castewada (last names may be spelled incorrectly). Reach out to these two gentlemen and they will be great resources to your stay in Hotel Angeleno. Sean and Jorge also helped us in providing us tips and recommendations as were to party/clubs/sight seeing/etc. And trust me they were very, very helpful. 3. The hotel and our room were always clean. They will always provide clean towels and room service was always on schedule to have everything clean and organized. 4. There's a heated pool outside - we unfortunately were not able to get in since our stay there was very busy with different activities each day. But I would have loved to get in plus they have a fireplace outside. (reminder we were there in December and sometimes the weather was chilly). 5. Everything was great at this hotel - I am even planning on staying there again when it comes to the All Stars game or when I go there again to continue exploring LA. Highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “HIRE CAR”
Reviews.Author: UkUrgent
Reviews.Content: u need to hire a car for this hotel otherwise u are stuck, there is nothing closer buy, search on map before u go, it costs to let visitors in

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for the Rose Bowl”
Reviews.Author: marthavilla2111
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights Dec. 31-Jan. 3rd for the Rose Bowl. (Buckeye Fans) This hotel had a great location, comfortable beds, and friendly staff. It was very quiet considering the location next to a highway. The Getty Museum was very close and bar on the top floor had a great view of Los Angeles. The only cons were the extra expense for valet parking and the water in the showers tended to go hot/cold/hot. We would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Smart & Classy!”
Reviews.Author: LeeChesterfield
Reviews.Content: Extremely easy to find - right off the 405 freeway at Sunset Blvd and an iconic Los Angeles building that is instantly recognisable. This former Holiday Inn has been amazingly remodelled into a sleek and stylish boutique property within the last couple of years. The only downside that we experienced is that parking is valet only at a rate of $20 per night - however the valet staff are very efficient and there was never a long wait for our vehicle at any time. A very efficient and friendly check in led us to a great room up on the 15th floor. Our room was very luxuriously furnished and pretty spacious for a city hotel. Bathroom was spotless and had a great walk in shower. Rooms are complete with robes, coffee making facilities and hair dryer as well as an iron in the wardrobe - the beds are super comfortable and virtually guarantee a good nights sleep!! The hotel provides ear plugs too - some noise can be heard from the freeway, however even though we were facing the freeway it did little to disturb our sleep and I wouldn't let this put me off staying here at all. The 17th floor bar & restaurant (West) is a very trendy establ;ishment and appears popular as a local hangout too - quite pricey but fabulous views across LA and the service cannot be faulted. Set as it is at the intersection of the 405 and Sunset Blvd it is extremely easy to navigate your way to the city's main sights - go right on Sunset and you're straight over to the beach and Santa Monica/Malibu - head left and you'll follow the Sunset Strip right into Hollywood. The 405 takes you straight down to Wilshire Blvd in about 3 minutes which in turn will take you right over to Beverly Hills. All in all this hotel provided us with a great base for exploring the city - I've visited LA various imes and stayed in different parts of the city but the location and standard of the Angeleno far outweighs anything that I've experienced here before. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good location if seeing LA without a car”
Reviews.Author: CompulsiveReviewer
Reviews.Content: We were here over New Years and got a great deal on getaroom.com. Welcome was warm and the hotel rooms were spacious and decorated in a smart corporate theme. Views are great but make sure you’re not too near the top floor, floor 17, as the bar is here and can get quite busy. Breakfast is expensive, as is anything marketed by the hotel (e.g. tours of Hollywood). Location is excellent - you can get on the bus outside the hotel for $1.25 and be in Hollywood within 45 min-1 hour. Lots of tours on sale here. The hotel also runs an excellent free shuttle service to Westwood, near the UCLA campus – a 5 street town with some fun restaurants and bars, and 3 cinemas. We really enjoyed walking from the hotel to Bel Air, Beverly Hills and Rodeo Drive –it takes 3 hours (the bus takes the same route). We were surprised to find that the hotel bar, West, is a popular spot for NYE. Do ask for a complimentary wine voucher at the reception when you arrive.

Reviews.Title: “Close to much on westside, sleep comfort, fragmented service with nessiities”
Reviews.Author: Cypresssea
Reviews.Content: Somewhat hip attractive, modern design. Rooms on the quiet side, not entirely though. Bed very comfortable, best part for me. They charge for business center, parking, and newspapers. The LA Times is only available M-F at hotel and there are apparently only a handful at cafe in morning. Everyone keeps asking for them as there aren't enough. And no alternative papers. The cafe closes to restock even in morning. I waited 25 minutes. It's clean, though fordetful. And it can take 40 minutes or more to get a towel or robe if you need to call front desk. Most of staff is kind and really seem to want to assist and care about your comfort. If they could tie up the few loose ends this is good place to stay in LA. Restaurant, at night weekend loud old pop music. So much, I had to leave. It hurt. Morning quiet decent breakfast but service not so hot. Didn't do room service. Good views

Reviews.Title: “Cosmopolitan hotel”
Reviews.Author: mevaleegrl
Reviews.Content: I was anxious about getting a quiet night's sleep at this hotel since it is situated above the 405 Freeway, and I'm a light sleeper. Well, I was pleasantly surprised !! Quiet rooms, comfortable, great bed and they leave ear plugs on the night stand just in case. Nice touch !!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish,comfortable, and well located.”
Reviews.Author: JC746
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Angeleno. The room and bath were comfortable and very much up to date. Great views from the top floor restaurant. All of the staff members I encountered were pleasant and courteous. A good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely!”
Reviews.Author: SpendLessTV
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Hotel Angeleno several times. The service is always excellent. The location and facilities are great. There have been a few minor glitches: coffee shop didn't open one morning, room service took too too long, restaurant hours should be longer, towels frayed..BUT having said that, we also found that the staff bends over backward to remedy any issues, and we're happy to report that the towels have been replaced. We would gladly stay there again anytime, and have referred to family and friends. We recommend requesting a room on the west side, away from the highway. And Monday night free jazz in the lounge is a real treat!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location, with one caveat.”
Reviews.Author: RuthSanDiego
Reviews.Content: Be forwarned that due to it's location there is a good deal of freeway noise. You could ask for a room that faces away from the freeway but then you would miss the view. Otherwise it was a wonderful place to stay, very convenient, the room was great, the service was very good. We used the free shuttle to go to and from the Getty, which was good because it costs to park there and it saved us from retrieving the car from the valet parking. We had a snack in the bar the first night. The food was good, although they could have kept the background music down a bit. We got a special rate, so overall it was a bargain. Don't know if I would pay full price.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: lara0
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week. The staff is wonderful, the food is good, the pool although it is small is nice and the rooms are fine... they have a van and a driver that can take you places in town...the hotel is right next to the highway so not too quite but convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful gem”
Reviews.Author: dcpam
Reviews.Content: This was the conference hotel and considering I grew up driving past the "round Holiday Inn" off the 405, I didn't expect much. I was surprised at how beautifully they've renovated it. The only gripe I have is the impossibly low water flow to the shower head. I had to get on my hands and knees to rinse the shampoo out of my hair. I appreciate that LA needs to conserve water, but this was not working for me. Great staff from baggage help, parking and front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent”
Reviews.Author: joaoosorio
Reviews.Content: Excelent Hotel. Good room, car parking and free wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible hotel, incredible staff, give it a try!”
Reviews.Author: Kappagirl
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel! I have stayed here several times this year and am always happy to come back. The staff is wonderful, especially a girl named Lesly who works at the front desk and is very gregarious, helpful and efficient. The managers are all great. The Hotel Angeleno offers a shuttle to take you to UCLA or anywhere within a 3-mile radius. One day I needed to go to UCLA and the shuttle wasn't available, so a manager named Scott arranged a taxi for me and took care of the bill. This is a luxury hotel, and the rooms are always clean with super comfortable beds, flat screen TV's, free wireless high speed, refrig in room, snacks, coffee, etc. The staff can arrange to have a microwave in the room if requested. The parking valets are courteous and efficient. The food is great and the breakfast bar for cappacino's is very convenient. Sign up for their Joy of Life (you can sign up online on their website) and you will receive a free bottle of wine or water on each visit as well as earn points. You will be pleased with the many amenities offered at this hotel. Just to let you know how thoughtful the staff is, I received a beautiful orchid plant from Lesly, Jose, Nick and staff when I had a medical visit. Another time when I entered my room there was a beautiful fruit basket waiting for me from the staff. The rates are reasonable, and sometimes they have specials. The hotel is in a great location, so close to everything. Give it a try, you'll be happy you did.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay here”
Reviews.Author: penelope2009Ireland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is basically right in the middle of a freeway, there are no shops, bars, restaurants around it... We were told we were staying centrally, it was a $30 taxi to get into the centre (hollywood blvd) the hotel itself was basic. Couldnt open our balcony door because of constant noise of traffic from the freeway. The restaurant and bar upstairs was overpriced. The staff were friendly and helpful but we discovered the tours we booked through them were way over priced. Would never ever stay there again it put a total dampner on our holiday...

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: dwtn
Reviews.Content: Pros: * Central location off 405 freeway for UCLA, Brentwood, etc. * Remodeled Holiday Inn that is part of Joie de Vivre chain, which like some of its SF properties means generally good value while getting something a little different than standard chain hotel * Bar on top floor with decent views of city Cons * Central location off 405 freeway means you may get a room facing the 405 freeway! Request room on other side. * Bar on top floor rather empty on weekend night * Parking $20 / night

Reviews.Title: “Smooth, convenient service, leaving nothing desired and nothing to think about.”
Reviews.Author: jsilbern
Reviews.Content: While it could be all about the location, which is itself reason to stay, this hotel is well appointed, conservative without being stuffy, modern without being pretentious. The building itself is so compact, and the space used so efficiently, I feel these qualities pervade the service and atmosphere, but in the best way. It is also likely that the view from the room will be beautiful. The only downside might be the noise from the freeway for some travelers, but it didn't bother me.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: cowdogss
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at this hotel several years ago when it was a Holiday Inn primarily for the excellent location (convenient to the 405, Westwood and Beverly Hills). When we returned to the hotel on this visit, we were amazed at the positive changes that had taken place under the new ownership. Beautiful redecorated lobby and rooms, very contemporary. Fantastic bed. Outstanding service from front desk and other staff. Absolutely everything was clean and polished Very nice hotel and good value

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Aaroninthesouthbay
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Hotel Angeleno were very accomodating and nice. This hotel is very central to the best LA has to offer. A brief 10-minute drive to the heart of the Sunset Strip! The hotel itself is very trendy, the remodel was done VERY well as this property used to be an outdated Holiday Inn. Overall great place to hang your hat on your next visit to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, pretty nice.”
Reviews.Author: MsPrudie
Reviews.Content: All rooms should have coffeepot, should not be an upgrade. Door on the bathroom (sliding door) was hard to move. Did not have a showerhead that you can move....on a cord. The bedding was phenominal. The noise from the freeway was annoying, but it was so conveniently located, it was worth it. Hated having to tip everytime we took out the car, but I guess that is just LA.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel where everything is broken! Stay at Luxe Hotel across the street instead.”
Reviews.Author: travelqueen618
Reviews.Content: My husband had an interview at UCLA so we booked the Hotel Angeleno because of its proximity to the UCLA campus and free shuttle service the hotel offered (proudly advertised on their official hotel website). However, when we arrived we were told the shuttle was broken and undergoing maintenance. Ok fine...so my husband had to take a 15 dollar cab ride to and from his interview. Thirty dollars we could have saved. Then, we get to our room and the balcony (which they also proudly advertise) is a total joke. It is so small and there is no furniture. You can only stand on it. Also, the towels in the bathroom look like they came from the dollar store. They were badly worn and frayed at the bottom. The following day, I go out to the pool...which was also broken. By this time, I was really mad. So the hotel offered to allow me to go over to Luxe Hotel across the street to use their pool. So inconveniently, I had to cross a very busy intersection and walk over to the other hotel to use their amenities. However, I was glad I did. The pool area at Luxe Hotel was beautiful. It is set up on a hill so it was very quiet. The cabanas and poolside loungers were very comfortable. The pool was also nicely heated. The staff was very friendly to me even though I wasn't a hotel guest. Later that day I decide to go upstairs to West, the hotel's restaurant. Yes, there are good views, but the drinks were disgusting and very strong. I ordered some calamari, which was average at best. The lounge area was also dirty. The couches stunk of stale beer and there was gum stuck to the tables. Ok it gets better...the following night we come home and the lobby was packed because 1 of 2 elevators was broken. We had to wait at least 15 minutes to get up to our room. The staff at the time, said the elevator was being fixed. However, the following afternoon, it was still broken. Prior to leaving for the airport we wanted to get cash for the cab ride. However, the ATM was broken. By this point I just laughed. This hotel is a total joke. They should have just left it a Holiday Inn because it would be better! Final Summary of Things Broken: 1. Shuttle 2. Pool 3. Elevator 4. ATM Machine

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel - Amazing Staff (Lesly & Edith) - Excellent Rooms - The Bed!”
Reviews.Author: MichaelScottsdale
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Hotel Angeleno over 200 nights the past few years for work and for pleasure. I can't believe I haven't reviewed this hotel yet. It's an incredible and very budget friendly hotel with an amazing restaurant/bar with a great view of the entire LA metro area. I continue to stay at Hotel Angeleno for a variety of reasons, but perhaps the most important is the quality of the staff. From the first time I stayed at Hotel Angeleno I felt very comfortable. The very first night I stayed here I stripped the bed, took pictures of the mattress labels and when I went home to Arizona I bought the same mattress and pillows. I don't think I have ever had a more comfortable hotel bed and I stay in hotels 200+ nights a year. There are two front desk staff members at Hotel Angeleno that I'd particularly like to mention. Lesly and Edith are the two friendliest and most courteous people I have ever met. I look forward to walking into the lobby every time I'm at this hotel and hope to see their friendly faces!

Reviews.Title: “Great ambiance and location”
Reviews.Author: Lathrops
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at Hotel Angeleno, the beds were so soft and comfortable. Great customer service and food was delicious. Location convenient to so many locations and minutes away from UCLA. I would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Repeat traveler!”
Reviews.Author: pcanfield
Reviews.Content: I always stay at the Angeleno Hotel when I travel to LA. It is centrally located for my business and the staff is exceptional. The rooms are comfortable to come back to after a long day of work and everyone is warm and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: NaVells
Reviews.Content: I had a great staff to take care of all my business needs. Thank you Jorge, Jouver & Tiffanie

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service and Attention to Detail!!!”
Reviews.Author: orange81
Reviews.Content: Loved the employees, especially the driver of their free shuttle service, Nick. The Hotel, Restaurant and pool areas were delightful.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, great rooms, great price, great location.”
Reviews.Author: BahiaSuenos
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at the Hotel Angeleno, and it will now be the place I stay every time I am in Los Angeles. Close to my work and close to everything else. I couldn't have been more pleased with the service and the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “aaahhh!”
Reviews.Author: Ceileen
Reviews.Content: Relaxing! Best bed ever! Very clean room and bath! Friendly staff! Great view from room and resturant.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel”
Reviews.Author: marion3034
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really good value, and ideally placed for those wihing to go to Hollywood, Santa Monica areas. The only downside is the $20 dollars parking- but that said, the staff were very efficient, and I suppose that parking is expensive where ever you go in L.A. I would definately stay here again, an ideal base for exploring that side of town, and about a 15 minute drive from the airport. There is a pool too, which looked nice but we didn't use it. The hotel is on the main road, but we were not disturbed by traffic noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Hotel angeleno”
Reviews.Author: imanib
Reviews.Content: Great stay i did not get in tell late but the staff where wonderful and helpfull and i can not wait to come back stay here more offten. The Front desk staff where very polite and nice and helpfull as well as the Valet parking staff.

Reviews.Title: “Joie de vivre?”
Reviews.Author: MarcSierens
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a noisy, very, very small room and even smaller bathroom and enjoy the sound of passing cars and the airco, then this is the place to be. But if you are looking for a calm, relaxing experience, then stay away. Joie de vivre? I’m from Belgium and there we understand French. Joie means pleasure and vivre means to live. There’s one positive note. If the people next door are giving a rough party you will not be disturbed because you’ll not hear it.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraRM
Reviews.Content: I was greeted with the warmest smiles and friendly attitudes from the Valet, to the Front Desk people, to the Housekeeping staff, to the Bar & Restaruant staff. Everyone. Undoubetdly the most pleasant hotel experience I've ever had, and I've traveled all over the world. The rooms are modern, beautiful and clean. The bedding is the finest I've seen and experienced. This hotel is the only hotel I would stay when in L.A. I have stayed there numerous times and am always completely impressed and satisfied by the amenities as well as the entire staff of employees. A first class hotel experience...

Reviews.Title: “Have had better stays at a Motel 6!”
Reviews.Author: 1teacher4u
Reviews.Content: My stay(that ended this morning) was absolutely awful starting with a valet (only parking available) who wouldn't check my car in until Ishowed confirmation that I had booked a room with the hotel. I couldn't get anyone to help carry my luggage; the room I was checked into had a dirty bathroom (coffee stains, dirt and debris in the tub and sink). I called to request new bedding and a clean bathroom early the next morning... when I returned after my business meetings, the new bedding/comforter on one of the beds was not dry...it had wet clumps of down/filling like rosettes all over the top of it. Luckily, there was the other bed to sleep in for that night. The next morning I called again to complain...there was no hair dryer in the bathroom, and no inner shower curtain so the floor was soaked every time after showering. The next to last night of my stay involved a air conditioner that was blowing out hot air, and a TV remote that quit working. I complained everyday to "guest services", and they did fix my a/c. I would have moved to another hotel if I had had the chance, and will certainly be reporting this experience to my employer who usually books 100-150 rooms at the hotel in August every year. I am a frequent traveler for business, and I can honestly tell you that I have had better experiences at a Motel 6 than I have staying at this hotel for the past 5 nights, and paying over $1,000 to this hotel!! Trust me, there's got to be better hotels near UCLA than this one.

Reviews.Title: “The best spot to relax and shop & etc”
Reviews.Author: xoleah38
