Reviews.Content: Jose the driver is a very nice young man. Bryan is another driver for the Angeleno Hotel services, and he's hilarious part time comedian too. So except laughter to be a major part of your stay. Blanca is an excellent front desk lady, her smile will brighten the whole front room! Edith helped me with traveling problems I ran into, and she did a great job helping. Lesly is a doll and always smiling! Kristina is the best by far!! I uproared some drama and everyone from the hotel were comforting and the hostipality blew my mind! If I stay anywher again it will the Angeleno hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the money”
Reviews.Author: dave_929
Reviews.Content: First of all, I got a great rate through a sale on Expedia, $109/night. For that price, there was nothing to complain about. The bed was really comfortable, and even though I had a room facing the freeway the noise was not noticeable. The staff was very nice too. I booked it a month out and closer to the departure date the rates were around $190/night. For that price, I'd probably want to stay elsewhere. The renovation that has been done is modern, but completely superficial and kind of cheap looking. The pictures on the walls looked like they were purchased at Ikea, and there were mismatched towels in the bathroom. But overall, you could do worse than staying here. Good location, nice staff, and clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved Everything about The Angeleno...you will too!”
Reviews.Author: SallyCalifornia
Reviews.Content: The Angeleno does a wonderful job of carrying on the tradition of JDV boutique hotels. We stayed here for a long get-away weekend. The room was perfect, bed fabulous, bathroom stocked & clean, quality of furnishings was very nice, and the hotel in general is very upscale, attractive, and close to so many things to see & do in L.A. The staff was friendly, accommodating, helpful, and made us feel at home. We had just a few requests, and they were responded to very quickly, and with maximum attentiveness. The staff made us feel at home, and we were also able to use the hotel van for several close-by drop-offs and pick-ups. We are world travelers, and very picky about where we stay. We will recommend The Angeleno to everyone. And we will absolutely stay here on all future trips to L.A.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: sugarl1952
Reviews.Content: This hotel looked pretty chic and trendy online, but in person it is definitely showing signs of wear. The staff was pleasant, but the room was no more comfortable than a Holiday Inn-type hotel. We were only given one towel in the bathroom initially, the tub drained very slowly, and our patio door didn't lock (which didnt bother us too much due to being four floors up). As for traveling with your significant other, the bathroom door is glass, so much for privacy! Also, the hotel prides itself on its beds, but the comforter was just sitting between two flat sheets, and then the matress was covered with another flat sheet so it was just a big tangle of sheets by the time you woke up in the morning! Overall, I was expecting more from a trendy, boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The noise was deafining”
Reviews.Author: SSM1X
Reviews.Content: Unless your staying on business I would say dont stay at this hotel. Why?? This hotel is NOT for holiday makers. The hotel is right next to a 12 lane free way, which is extremely noisy even with the patio door closed leading to the balcony. The noise comes throught the AC vent which is directly connected to the outside wall, without any sound proofing, not what you would expect from a 4* hotel. THE HOTEL STAFF AT THE FRONT RECEPTION DESK ARE EXTREMELY FRIENDLY AND VERY HELPFULL & COULDN'T DO MORE TO HELP. The hotel is very well decorated through out and has a modern and contemporary feel THE HOTEL BEDS ARE THE MOST CONFORTABLE BEDS I HAVE EVER SLEPT IN "EXCELLENT" . The rooms are kept very clean and are very well furnished & decorated- Excellent. . However you cannot relax in such noise, it is just not possible, therefore the price in my opinion does not reflect the noise you have to put up with. I would say the opposite, the hotel is too expensive when considering the immense noise you have to put up with 24/7, even if the hotel is at a fairly reasonable price for this part of LA. Valet parking is not included in the service and is $18 dollars a night The valet parking is quite annoying because each time you arrive, car is parked in the lot due to lack of spaces outside. In the morning getting your car can take up to 10 minutes due to line of people waiting. Hotel cafe shop had a lot to be desired. Extremely non responsive and a bad attitude of girl working behind counter. Made you feel very unwelcome. The bar closed very early and the cafe was closed a lot of the time when you needed it. The pool area was ok and the hotel has a resonable gym. But no waiter pool service provided for drinks or food. There are no walking distance amenities near the hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “'A' for Effort & Service”
Reviews.Author: SanFranciscoGreen
Reviews.Content: We had a blast! It was my brothers 30th birthday and we needed a place where we could all come together. We had people from LA, San Francisco, the central valley, wine country & Montana and the folks at The Hotel Angeleno were very helpful from booking the dinner, arranging the cake, arranging transprortation, reserving space in the lounge for the surprise to our rooms, which were super cute! The staff was friendly and accomodating and went above and beyound the call of duty! The dinner was wonderful. We didn't have to ask for a thing.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended-I'll stay here whenever I'm in LA”
Reviews.Author: RunningBearTrans
Reviews.Content: From check-in to check-out, I was treated like a favorite Uncle during my stay at the Angeleno. The room was beautiful, the beds are heavenly and the view of the city from my balcony was wonderful. The restaurant..WOW! The dining atmoshere was elegant but not fussy, and the food was superb. Recommended by a Bel-Air "local".

Reviews.Title: “Pretty average at best”
Reviews.Author: Scapa
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews about the traffic noise and thought it would not be too bad but it is really bad and does intrude and seems to come through the a/c even when the doors are closed. The rooms are pretty small and the photos do indeed flatter. We found the pool area dead at night with folks able to wander in and smoke there and the tiny cafe there is closed at night. It was not inviting and the next hotel we stayed in showed how to make an area like that work. So you have to go up to the very expensive bar upstairs. The valet parking is really annoying as you have to pay tip and wait every time you go out and you really need a car for pretty every trip although we found a nice Starbucks and coffee shop in a center 15 minutes walk away so we went there and did not bother with the overpriced breakfast. The hotel seems all pretentiousness but underneath it is just ok at best. In our room the wireless internet was very, very slow and kept closing so watch for that! We liked Brentwood as an area though as this center is nice where Starbucks is nice and the Getty is close.

Reviews.Title: “Will Not Return”
Reviews.Author: pegnbuck
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Angeleno and other hotels of the JDV group and have been pretty pleased. But the attitude at the front desk and from the coffee bar help was terrible. We wondered if there was a newspaper in the house (yes, I know they are going away but we still enjoy them with our coffee) and they were worse than dismissive. No, no paper and they couldn't tell him where to purchase one nearby....and they couldn't have cared less. The night before, in the restaurant, we were speculating about the company buying up all these waterfront properties (this one is not waterfront but many of theirs are) and rehabbing them in such a shoddy way. My husband thinks they figure this style will go out in a few years and they will have to re-do them anyway. So, save the money and put it in the property...the real investment.

Reviews.Title: “Much less than I was expecting...”
Reviews.Author: JFMStuttgart_Germany
Reviews.Content: While it is true that the hotel Angeleno is quite good, I was expecting much more value for the money paid. Rooms are OK, but not that spectacular as they look on the website. The room's balcony was directly located over the freeway...Breakfast is not included in the price!! (which was a big surprise for many of the colleagues that were travelling with me, as well). The little coffee shop downstairs is very expensive and has a limited offer...And finally, the only option for having dinner is "The West": nice place atop the hotel, but pricey and with a very small food offer. Very small business center! It is highly recommendable to rent a car if you'll stay at the Angeleno.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, would recommend to anyone”
Reviews.Author: ctdg
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Angeleno in September 2008 for couple of nights, and couldn't fault anything. Service was excellent from check in to check out, the rooms were immaculate, and the hotel is in a great location to get around LA from. The hotel is only 10 minutes from LAX, providing you don't get stuck in traffic on the 405 (which is actually quite likely). Although the hotel is just inches from the 405, and our room pretty much faced it, we didn't notice much noise coming in at all. You can only use valet parking (they don't allow self parking) but it's only $18 a night, which is a steal compared to a Holiday Inn we stayed at in San Fran at $40 a night for a pretty unsecure open air car park. The outside bar is a really great way to end the night sitting by the fire, and drinks were much cheaper than some of the restaurants we visited. Next time I end up in LA again, I'll definately be staying at the Angeleno again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the Angeleno”
Reviews.Author: travel_soldier
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I had a great stay at the Angeleno. It is very much a boutique style hotel although with 15+ floors it certainly isn't small. It is very easy to get to from the airport - you just head north on the freeway (traffic permitting). One of the nicest assets of this hotel is the bar and restaurant that sits on the top floor with fantastic views of the city and great food - probably one of the best steaks in my life! Not so light on the wallet though but well worth it if you want to treat yourselves! We did not use the pool but it looked pretty nice and they light a fire by the poolside in the evening. The staff were friendly and very helpful - printing out directions for us etc. Main downside is the big freeway that is adjacent to the hotel. We did not find it too much of a problem but it is pretty loud. Foam earplugs are in the amenity kit for those who sleep light. Pros Nice room, great bar and restaurant, easy to get to from the airport and in reasonably close to hollywood, beverly hills and Santa Monica. Non smoking hotel Cons Next to a very busy highway, $19 valet charge for parking

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, helpful staff in updated hotel with great location.”
Reviews.Author: Ollierae
Reviews.Content: Every now and then everything goes "perfect" on a trip and this was it! I was skeptical of the "older" building when the cab pulled up but the smiling, respectful doorman (Shaun) followed by the pleasant check in girls was encouraging and then when I entered my single room to find a snappy updated place I was delighted. The shuttle driver Jose couldn't have been better--suggesting and taking me to a lovely restaurant close by then picking me up. The next day before taking me to my place of business he suggested a visit to the J. Paul Getty museum (don't miss it) which was truly delightful and set a happy tone for the rest of the day. These folks were sincere and most helpful. Hats off to them all.

Reviews.Title: “Hip hotel”
Reviews.Author: pjsGeorgia
Reviews.Content: Loved dark wood contrasting with pristine white comfortab;e bedding. Very clean, new, elegant feel. Front desk and valet were friendly. Rooms are small with small upgrated extras. We were on 11th floor on the 405 side. It was noisy if the door was opened to the balcony. but the heavy glass muted most of it. Movies could be ordered at a charge and the sound of the road did not interfere with conversation or viewing. The bathroon had a large shower area with a clear glass wall. We booked online for an excellent rate. We ate at West on the top floor. Dinner was good but expensive. Drinks were $12. Prime Rib was $40 and had to be sent back. 2nd piece was delicious. They advertised a fondue board but it was not avaiable. They called Union cabs for us to go to the airport. The van drove very slowly so traffic passed us on all sides. Ride was $40. plus tip (that he did not deserve!) Call your own.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, OK Location”
Reviews.Author: jkshibley
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel angeleno for the first four days of our trip around california. The staff were polite and helpful. Beds were very comfortable and much needed after traveling for 24hours. Rooms were nice and modern and bathroom was clean with nice toilettries. Air conditioning unit was loud so we were unable to have this on at night. Hotel is right on the 405 about 30mins from the airport. Valet parking is $18 a day and you will need a car. There are no restaurants, shops or bars within walking distance, but Santa Monica and Sunset strip are 5-10 mins drive. Hotel had a pool and leisure facility, we did not use this but it appeared nice. The hotel is good value (we paid £50 a night through hotels.com) and the location is ok.

Reviews.Title: “Well Located and Comfortable Property”
Reviews.Author: EZT
Reviews.Content: Our two nights here was quite satisfactory. The Rooms were very good, largish, and spacious. Good King Size Bed, and large LCD screen. Toilettes very adequate and so was the deco and the carpet. Hotel is right next to the 405 freeway but the location is good as you are 100 mts from Sunset Boulevard and a short drive away from Brentwood's very good restaurants. You must have a car of course in LA and to stay in this property. Carparking in the hotel is extra at $17 per day. Internet in the property is excellent and complimentary even in your room. We found no faults with this hotel and were very pleased with the service and the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre Rehab of Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: DuncanTraveler
Reviews.Content: They tried hard to turn a former Holiday Inn into a hip hotel and couldn't do it. The location is very isolated. The rooms are decent at best (although clean). Service is fine but not great. The only positive was the restaurant on the top floor but you can stay somewhere else and go there if you like.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel Experience!”
Reviews.Author: jmacgregor
Reviews.Content: I lived in L.A. for 15 years and remembered this hotel as being a Holiday Inn so I knew the rooms would be a little on the small side, but we were very pleased with our experience. The purpose of our trip was to visit friends in Sherman Oaks and a trip to the Getty - the location was great for both. In fact, the hotel is less than 5 minutes from the entrance to the Getty museum (Los Angeles - not Malibu Villa). The entire staff was courteous and professional. The mandatory valet is a bit of a bummer ($19) but know that going in so be happy that your car is parked in a secure area. We left the hotel on Sunday morning at 9:30 so the valet stand was very busy, but I'm sure we did not wait more than 5 minutes for our car. As for the noise level from the 405, it was not nearly as bad as I thought it would be from reading the other reviews. I would consider myself to be a very light sleeper and was initially apprehensive about the hotel's location. When the sliding glass door on the balcony was closed, the rushing cars provided what I would describe as “white noise”. The speed on that particular stretch of the highway is brisk at night and there is certainly none of the honking and disruptive traffic noise that one would hear on a busy city street. For us, the noise was not even an issue. We requested a west facing room at check-in but would probably not do so on our next visit because we missed the amazing views from the south side of the hotel and I don’t think a few feet in either direction will make a difference in the level of freeway noise. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel based on the cleanliness, location, staff professionalism and the VERY comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy location with poor management”
Reviews.Author: Reasonable_9
Reviews.Content: Located between two expressways, really noisy from traffic even at 5:15 a.m. Sunday morning! Management unsympathetic. After several tries to reach management, changed our room from across the ice machine to a less but still noisy side. Good location if you have a hang over and can't hear anything!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay with great people to serve you.”
Reviews.Author: angelenoista
Reviews.Content: I have spent many nights here and aside from the noise of the 405 Freeway, I have always enjoyed the stay. The staff are all friendly and very helpful. The food from West Restaurant is excellent. I always stay in an Executive Room, the best choice, and find it to be very accommodating. The work station is convenient, the flat screen T.V. and comfy chair work well for relaxing. The bathroom with a walk in shower is nice. The plush towels and bathrobes add a positive aspect to the experience. The pillowtop bed offers a great nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel... No 'Wow' Factor”
Reviews.Author: TheGreatGambini
Reviews.Content: We booked into the Angelena Hotel for 6 nights (and we are currently on night 5 as we write this review). Firstly, the positives: The room rate that we managed to get was brilliant for the area. All other options were in excess of $180 p/night, whilst our room at the Angeleno was $104 p/night (Not including $18 p/night Valet Parking) - we got the room through cheaprooms.com for anyone looking to stay here. The hotel itself is clean, decorated well, and has friendly staff both at the reception and valet. However, that's where the problem starts... there's no real "wow" to this hotel (I guess you have to pay for it, but still...) everything is just... "nice" or "adequate". The rooms are pretty small so I would not recommend this for groups or families - the room is just barely big enough to accomodate my wife and I (and 2 bags!). We managed to get an "Executive" room in our rate, but that basically means you're on a higher floor with a better view and mounted LCD TV. Beware the 360 views of the rooms on the website - they make the rooms look a lot bigger than they actually are! There is one major problem with the Executive rooms... for some bizzare reason, the hotel have placed the conference rooms on the top level of the hotel, so if you're staying on floor 15 (like we are) expect to hear a LOT of noise (chairs/tables being dragged across the floor) throughout the day and early morning from the floor above. We did complain about this, but all the staff can do is move you to a lower floor, which means you lose the view... so the "Executive" room is a double edged sword. Due to the location of the hotel you tend to be driving out a lot to find places to eat - there's nothing in the immediate surrounding area and there's only one resteraunt in the hotel which is very pricey. Special note must go to the breakfast at the hotel... it's VERY expensive, but VERY good! FInally, Valet Parking... it's $18 a night for guests staying at the hotel and also for outside visitors just visiting the hotel. I would really expect guests staying at the hotel to get a better rate, but not so here. In conclusion, it's a "nice" rate for a "nice" hotel. Anyone visiting for leisure may want to look at other (slightly more expensive) options which have slightly larger rooms and more immediate amenities in the vicinity. Would give it 3.5, but the rating only allows whole numbers, so a 3 it is.

Reviews.Title: “This has been one of my best hotels during my travels.”
Reviews.Author: Jerseygirl1017
Reviews.Content: Advertisement would be excellent for this hotel. I have experience a good enviroment here and would like to see others enjoy their stay hee as I have.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic bed.. location very undesirable”
Reviews.Author: darwinlyn
Reviews.Content: No complaints about the hotel or service.. Unfortunately the location was not what we expected.. In the middle of numerous freeways does leave a lot to be desired.. Room service for a hamburger and a small chicken meal cost in excess of $110 Aust dollars... Not very happy when no other option is readily available due to location.... I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Emma031
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from L.A. recently where I spent four days at Hotel Angeleno. Our daughter is a Bruin, and we visit her often. As a family we have tried just about every luxury hotel in the area, which is an enormous selection! This is only our second visit with Hotel Angeleno, and after my most recent stay we are hooked. All the basics are the same, clean, comfortable and elegant in a relaxed way, as most hotels we have visited, but, this hotel steps it up with their incredible staff! From the Valet's to Housekeeping, all are courteous, flexible and personable. The Front Desk, which I believe can make or break a hotel stay is awesome! Everyone I dealt with from checking in too special requests were outstanding, friendly, gracious, professional and accomadating to my every need. The location is very convenient, close to shopping and great dining and not far at all to Santa Monica area. I strongly recommend Hotel Angeleno!

Reviews.Title: “staff is great and hotel is fantastic”
Reviews.Author: jwli
Reviews.Content: I am a second generation visitor. My father use to stay here and now so do I. If I know I am going to be in town there is only one place I book my rooms. That is here at the Angeleno. There is no other place like it. The pool area is spectaular and very romantic once the fireplace gets going, and the restaraunt upstairs is fantastic. with an amazing view. Its never a question of where I am going to stay because there is only one place in my book to be. Thats this hotel. Thank you to all the staff that make this place unbeatable. JSW. Dallas TX

Reviews.Title: “Angeleno is the whole package”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeScottsdale
Reviews.Content: At my age I have had the opportunity to stay at many hotels around the world. Like most travelers, I want location, comfort, cleanliness, service and good food. When all these are present at a good rate, that equals value. Hotel Angeleno delivers. I would like to add that the West restaurant delivers great food plus great views of LA from its top story location. This was my second stay and I plan to return and will also advise my friends and family to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: sscrios
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend Hotel Angeleno great room , servise and the resturant/ bar at the Angeleno was incrediable.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and accomodating”
Reviews.Author: TulsaCowboy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hotel Angeleno on a consistent basis for almost 4 years. It is convenient to Brentwood, Bel Air, Westwood, Beverly Hills and Santa Monica. The staff is excellent and accomodating. I highly recomment the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Confident colleagues would leave impressed...”
Reviews.Author: Uprizzzing
Reviews.Content: ...and they were. From the moment the rental car pulls in and the treatment is stellar whether you drive a Civic or an Aston Martin; from the greeting as the front door opens for you and wonderful reception at check in; from the personalized touches welcoming you to the hotel ... every stay at Hotel Angeleno has been a great experience. I knew my colleagues would feel the same. They arrived and were immediately impressed. I brought them to the West restaurant upstairs - drinks, food, jazz - they were again impressed. Waking the next morning and hearing, "it's rare a hotel bed is more comfortable than the one I have at home." Impressed. They didn't want to leave for the next leg of their trip where they knew the food, the ameneties, the service, the view ... that every element of their next stop would leave them begging to return. Needless to say, I'll be getting more support for my project in LA thanks to colleagues wanting to return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Finally, I don't have to think about where to stay in L.A.”
Reviews.Author: MrFurious
Reviews.Content: After several years of poking around, Angeleno is everything I have been looking for in an L.A. metro hotel. I *finally* don't have to think about where I want to stay anymore! Right off the bat, their location is spectacular. You can throw a rock and hit the 405 (but don't actually do that...). Within 10 minutes you can be on Ventura Blvd in Studio City, or 3rd Street in Santa Monica, or at the Grove in Beverly Hills. Want to go down to Disneyland for the day? It's only 35 minutes if you leave at the right time... The hotel rooms are delightfully pleasant. The round architecture provides interesting room design, and Angeleno devoted a lot of great effort to optimizing the room configuration. After living there for a week I've decided the result is perfect use of space. I admin I was worried about traffic noise, but the balcony doors effectively drown it out. And if you travel with a white noise machine as I do, you will hear literally nothing, even if you sleep through the morning. (If you don't travel with white noise, I've no idae what your expectations of a hotel may be...) I have to write a paragraph on its own about the bed. I come from an elitist Tempurpedic mattress at home, and Angeleno's bed was very plainly a lot more comfortable. I forgot to look at the tag to find out who made it, but the fact that it occurred to me to have done so should speak volumes. I never sleep well in hotels. But Angeleno's bed had me the first night. Not too hot, not too cold, not too hard, but just right. I think I slept 11 hours. The hotel staff are, frankly, perfect. They fade into the background, which is exactly what I want. Perfectly courteous when I checked in, and cognizant enough to welcome me back with simple greetings as I came back each day. I have to give exta special credit to the hotel's Valet and Housekeeping teams. They were spectacular! Literally every day (all hours) I called down for my car from my room, and it drove up as I walked from the elevator to the front door. I mean these guys are either magic or very on top of things (or both). And Housekeeping made sure to visit no matter how late I slept. The room was immaculate every time I entered it. One night I forgot to put up the Do Not Disturb sign, but still they didn't knock because they knew I was still asleep. Truly, this hotel is well-run, very reasonably priced, and comes highly recommended from yours truly.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the whole experience”
Reviews.Author: lmattace
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hotel Angeleno was a great experience. Situated close to the 405 freeway and Sunset Blvd., we found the location very convenient to our sight-seeing needs. The service was impeccable and the rooms clean and comfy. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: MljH
Reviews.Content: When we think about Hotel Angeleno, we most remember the luxurious bed! It was so comfortable, and a great get away. The room was small, nicely furnished and perfect for two. The hotel sits along a busy freeway, but we were never bothered by noise, though our room was around on the side away from the highway, so this might have helped. We had limited interaction with the staff, but what we did have, was pleasant. Checkout via our in-room television was quick and easy. The nightclub on top of the hotel was fun, and offered a beautiful view of LA at night. When we were there, it wasn't crowded - so we enjoyed great conversation and music. I would recommend this hotel if your trip takes you near Brentwood or Bellaire. Our family members live nearby, and it provided a convenient place to stay without making them have to sit in traffic to come to get us.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous place to stay”
Reviews.Author: bdbd55
Reviews.Content: A diamond in the rough. I was pleasantly surprised to find out how nice this hotel was. It was a great place to stay for the money. The rooms and hotel were nicer than some of my friends staying in more expensive hotels in the area. This place was first class. The rooms were very chic. Very comfortable and quiet. Great pool with fireplace. Top floor restaurant and bar had fantastic views of the area. Front desk staff were extremely helpful. Located only 9 miles from airport and close to UCLA and Beverly Hills. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. Thanks for such a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Angeleno Happiness”
Reviews.Author: KayakL8
Reviews.Content: Former circular tower Holiday Inn converted to a modern, euro-style hotel. Rooms are very nice with great beds. Hotel staff is excellent. Front desk on first & second shifts knew me by name within the first week. Everyone very curteous and service oriented. They work hard to make you feel welcome and at home and do a great job of it. Restaurant and lounge on top (17th floor) very upscale. Food is delicious. Hotel has a very european flavor and has an eclectic group of well educated guests from many countries.

Reviews.Title: “Best Buy”
Reviews.Author: worldwideleo
Reviews.Content: Renewed: clean, fashion and with good rates. Nice and fancy restaurant with a beautiful night view of west LA. Handy: close to Santa Monica, Bel Aire, Beverly Hills and Paul Getty Center (must see - not much for art, but for architetonics). Only 20 min from LAX airport by 405. At first I was scared because of the noise of highway aside, but all rooms are double-layered-very-thick-windows. Very silent.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: DevMarc
Reviews.Content: This hotel used to be a Holiday Inn and was then remodeled and now has a different name. It is very centrally located right off the 405, just off of Sunset Blvd. in Brentwood, right up the street from Beverly Hills. The hotel is next to the freeway, so if freeway noise bothers you, this isn't the hotel for you, but it was muted, and with the a/c or heat on, which is loud, you can't hear the traffic at all. The rooms were small but very nicely decorated, the bathroom was spacious, and for the price (I paid about 250 on a Thurs. night, with my AAA discount, including parking and tax), it was a good rate for this area. I would stay there again. Also, there is a highly recommended restaurant on top called West, but I didn't have the opportunity to go there.

Reviews.Title: “Road noise outweighs the good”
Reviews.Author: elaine_dm
Reviews.Content: Likes: - Room very cozy, and nicely furnished Dislikes: - Road noise was horrible even during the night - Valet parking $18 (most expensive parking I ever had to pay) - Had a few stains on our comforter which was pretty gross

Reviews.Title: “Nice Getaway”
Reviews.Author: trvlmaven
Reviews.Content: Hotel Angeleno was a very nice place to stay for a few days. The room was a little small but comfortable. Beds were above average. Great pool area to relax around- there is a fireplace on at night as well. Hotel did not seem very crowded or noisy. Traffic noise was not an issue as some reviews said. Only drawback- $18 for valet parking- I like having a choice of valet or self-park. But otherwise, very enjoyable. Good location- about 10 minutes from Beverly Hills and Westside, and 10 minutes to the Valley. We went out to Malibu one day- only about 25 minutes. Got a great price with Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: paul_jen_8
Reviews.Content: Paul & Jen kendal cumbrai england We stayed here for 8 days and the staff were kind and helpfull We stopped on the 10th floor over looking Los Angeles and what a view. The only thing is the 405 freeway runs along that side of the hotel but after a while the noise of the 405 dosent bother u. The meals at the hotel were very goog and where you have them is the 17th floor. If we ever go back to Los Angeles we would stay here agin.

Reviews.Title: “I loved the Hotel Angeleno!”
Reviews.Author: zoegirl122
Reviews.Content: I just came home from LA where I stayed at the Hotel Angeleno in Brentwood. My husband and I enjoyed the pool area, which is very tranquil and were able to get in our workouts as well in their workout room. The restaurant was fantastic with great service to boot. Overall, we were very comfortable there and the staff is very friendly and helpful. I will go back the next time I am in LA.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel but horrible road noise”
Reviews.Author: nosuchname
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right next to I-405. It looks better inside then outside. The rooms are very small but nicely furnished and clean. Service is good and friendly, but as typical for LA you are better of if you speak some Spanish. Room service menu is standard but food quality was very good. I didn't visit the Restaurant. If you do business at UCLA, you can take the bus (302 or 2) from the hotel leaves about every 15 min and takes about 15 minutes. Only problem is that you have to cross two busy roads to get to the bus station. On the way back, the bus will drop you off right at the hotel. (only one road to cross). My main issue is the road noise. My room was facing 405 and the road noise was very bad at times of day/night. The balcony they advertise is not usable. The in-wall air conditioner doesn't help. Luckily I didn't have to use it. But it is louder then the road noise (someone suggested to use it to drown out the road noise). There is essentially nothing within walking distance. Some stores about a 15 minute walk along a busy road with partial sidewalk. Bus #2/302 is your friend again. Cab ride to/from airport is approx. $40, Shuttle bus $20. Local bus rides are $1.25 (exact change needed).

Reviews.Title: “Good for what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: RUSTYknoxville
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd and last stay in our tour of California. The service was fine and the bar at the top floor was brilliant. Me and my mates quiet happily went for some nice drinks and A*** food most nights. The location was a bit annoyly so only go there if your hiring a car. Vallet parking was efficient and worked well. Pool area was classy and modern, sometimes you seemed a bit too enclosed though. But it's not supposed to be a 2 weeks beach holiday resort. It was great. Not perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Good for One Night Stays, Shame About the Location”
Reviews.Author: NickyU
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in August, at the end of a much larger tour. The staff were very helpful, rooms small but adequate, beds comfortable. The hotel is located in a really good area, however, it is a real shame that the hotel is right next to the freeway, and although the windows do stop most of the noise, there is no escaping from the slight hum of the traffic. It is well located for visiting the Getty Centre, which is great, but there are no coffee shops or restaurants within walking distance, so a car is essential, or you would be trapped into eating in the hotel which is a bit expensive. On the whole, we wouldn't stay here again, really due to the location, probably great if you are on a business trip, but not great for a holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Sheelapeela
Reviews.Content: I joined friends who were staying in LA at this hotel and we were there for five nights. After very busy days touring and shopping, it was always a pleasure to come back to this hotel and relax and unwind before going out in the evening. My room was cleaned every day and fresh towels and sheets provided. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The restaurant on the 17th floor was especially nice and a real treat. The location was excellent as well and we seemed to be central to all the sites we wanted to visit. I would definitely return to stay here and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Modern, Simple..”
Reviews.Author: ZSDub
Reviews.Content: Hotel Angeleno is a decent hotel. I had the opportunity to stay here for one evening and although the rooms aren't that big, they are big enough for two people to rest comfortably. The hotel is pretty clean and has decent, contemporary interior design. They also have a small pool (but no jacuzzi) and a hotel sized gym. I would definitely recommend requesting a room that's not facing the freeway! The housekeeping staff, valet and bellboys were incredibly warm and went out of their way to be hospitable. They seemed to hold the place together and their service was A+ Strangely enough, it was the front desk staff that was very lukewarm in their service and attitude. When I arrived the girl overseeing the front desk was in the back hanging out and seemed annoyed when I sent someone to get her so we could check in. This was the general attitude of the front desk, and throughout my stay I noticed from my interactions that they only cared to do the bare minimum to help their guests. Maybe they were just having a bad day but they could certainly take some pointers from the service staff. Overall, Hotel Angeleno is a decent hotel and they would get 4 stars if I had a better experience with the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for a quick visit”
Reviews.Author: DiamondgeeezerLondon
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect for exploring the local sights and is very close to Santa Monica beach. A car is essential and the valet parking was first rate.Only sang was that it cost $18 per day. The rooms arent the biggest but you wont be spending much time in them anyway. The staff were very good particulary Christina on the front desk who gave us great advice on places to visit and eat. The proximity to the highway and Sunset Blvd meant that after a couple of days I didnt bother with the GPS. Nice pool area too with log fire for those surprisingly cool August nights. Top Floor resturant The West was fantastic. Pricey but classy. Would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “A hip Holiday Inn?”
Reviews.Author: Oakville-Realtor
Reviews.Content: This is an odd hotel, seemingly trying to be more then it is. If I was 25 to 30 I probably would think this is a fab hotel, but I'm not. In fact it should really should say, "if you're under 30 and have a few dollars you'll love us, but if your 30 plus you might want to look further." It isn't that the hotel isn't hip, it is. But it is noisy (I stayed on the freeway side), the rooms are small yet stylish, and the restaurant on the 17th floor with Jazz music and decent food does have a great view (but the service is immature). It isn't that they don't care, but are too inexperienced to know better. Maybe, I'm a little too old for this one, and a little too familiar with LA to buy into the "vibe". I just expect a little more from a boutique hotel, and maybe that is it. The Angeleno is a Hip Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “FAB FRIENDLY HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Pembsskier
Reviews.Content: Arrived late afternoon valet immediately welcomed us, staff at reception desk very helpful. Hotel pool and area was very clean towels always available. Small snack area very convenient if you were in a hurry. Rooms very clean Restaurant at the top of the hotel 1st class views were outstanding. Try to request a room away from the freeway if possible. Would certainly stay here again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate Angeleno”
Reviews.Author: sunnyps
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Angeleno for one night because I had a meeting nearby. My first impression, even though I knew roughly where it was, is that the hotel is so close to the 405 freeway. The hotel is kind of hip and kind of well decorated. The room is small and doesn't actually have a closet. There's a small cupboard/armiore that contains a small space for your clothes and the ironing board and iron. The TV is on the dresser/desk as someone earlier wrote about. Breakfast in West, the hotel's restaurant was just fine, no complaints. My stay was very short and was for business. I would never go back for any kind of leisure travel because of the hotels location and small rooms. Also, there's no place to walk nearby (for coffee, etc). If you have a reason to stay overnight near UCLA or nearby its just fine. There's no way to escape the dull roar of the freeway below even with what appear to be new soundproof windows.

Reviews.Title: “Not So Hot on this Hot List Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kjytraveler
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Angeleno promotes that it was on the 2007 Conde Nast Traveler Hot List of new hotels - I don't know why editors selected this spot. Granted, the hotel is nicely decorated - it has a very hip, chic appeal that is very appropriate for it's location. But when it comes to service - this hotel is not so hot. When we checked in, we were told we would get upgraded - we found out this was from a standard room that was "noisy" to a standard room that wasn't noisy. The hotel's convenient location next to the 405 is great for commuting to business meetings but apparently bad if you get stuck on the noisy side of the hotel. My room key didn't work and it took three trips to the front desk to resolve the issue. The front desk team was very nice but they did not do anything to address my inconvenience. The next morning they forgot my wake up call and I had to call my breakfast appointment to move it back by an hour. Then, on my last morning, it took an hour to get oatmeal and berries when I was told it woul take a half hour. When I called to check on my order, the person on the phone said they forgot. The only redeeming qualities that will make me reconsieder another visit to this hotel are 1) it's convenient access to the 405 2) the comfortable beds 3) and service at West, the hotel restaurant. The food was exceptional but the wait staff was engaging and fun to be around. They picked us up after a busy morning of meetings. I heard a lot of "I'm sorry" comments at the Hotel Angeleno. I would have preferred to have been asked what they could do to make my stay more enjoyable. In the long run, the service was just not so hot.

Reviews.Title: “OK for short stay only”
Reviews.Author: austravelAustralia
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Angeleno for a short stay in February 2008, as part of a world trip. It was ultra modern and the rooms were very compact – I think it would be difficult to stay here for an extended period of time, due to the lack of space, but for a short stay it is OK. Given that I was on a world trip, there wasn’t nearly enough room for luggage. The rooms contained quite a good mini-bar and even had a small balcony, but were still quite stuffy. There was quite a bit of traffic noise coming through into the room, which wasn’t conducive to sleeping. A lot of the surfaces in the room seemed dusty also. The reception staff were friendly, but the porters were not reliable. I gave one of them a large tip on the basis that he would return in an hour to help us, but he never turned up as promised, which was frustrating as I then had to tip another porter to help us. There is a limited room service menu, which I ordered from on the first night, and I must say that the food was excellent – it was one of the best meal’s I had in the US.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous experience!”
Reviews.Author: tvnewseditor
Reviews.Content: We had the Hotel Angeleno chosen for us by Hotwire.com so I was a little worried about what we'd end up getting for our anonymous bargain rate. My concerns were heightened after reading some of the reviews here on Trip Advisor. I must say, though, that the people who were complaining either didn't know what they were talking about or their concerns were noted by the hotel and addressed/resolved before we got there. The great: * hotel is very conveniently located right off the 405. This was our first trip to LA so we wanted to hit lots of the "tourist" spots - nothing was more than half an hour away, factoring in the "horrible" LA traffic (which wasn't really so bad). * check-in and checkout were a breeze and the hotel staff were all very friendly * Contrary to a previous poster's opinion, we were not harassed about taking any tours that the hotel was hawking. They did mention it upon check-in and then once more when we were lounging in the hotel lobby, but it wasn't high-pressure. * Uur room was beautiful and roomy * Our room faced the interstate but the traffic noise wasn't very loud at all. We opened the balondy door and were overwhelmed with the road noise but when we shut the door, it was just as quiet as any other hotel room we've ever stayed in. * Valet was very prompt in bringing around our car - when we called down for it to be brought around, it was always there waiting for us when we got there. The not as good but not worth complaining about: * 3 very shallow dresser drawers and very limited closet hanging space in our room - no place to stash our suitcase out of the way * very thin/poor quality bed sheet which literally ripped in my hands when I rolled over during the night * hotel bar was pretty loud and rowdy - but it was a weekend night so I guess that's to be expected * there are no restaurants near the hotel so we ate breakfast in the hotel restaurant our first morning there - but never again - it was too expensive (appx $25/head) and they weren't even apologetic when their weirdo contemporary-design teapot didn't pour properly spilled hot tea all over. * 18/night mandatory valet - I knew to expect the mandatory valet and I even knew the price, but it still seems a little steep.

Reviews.Title: “Good location despite initial misgivings.”
Reviews.Author: lasvegas-marmalade
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Los Angeles by train from San Francisco and took a taxi to the hotel. Our initial concerns were that the hotel appeared to be miles from anywhere and also at the intersection of several large highways. However, it is situated near local bus stops and we found we could travel around Los Angeles and down to Santa Monica and Venice with no difficulty. Both the hotel valet staff and local bus drivers are extremely helpful-more so than the taxi drivers! The hotel has everything needed and the rooms were very comfortable. There was little noise inside the room despite being surrounded by many lanes of busy roads. I would highly recommend this hotel for a short break in Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: tcuckt
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic! The customer service was great and the rooms were wonderful! We loved the comfort of the bed and it was a central location to everything. The pool scene is fun and this hotel offers lots of extras!

Reviews.Title: “Not as noisey and loud as most say it is”
Reviews.Author: ejicon
Reviews.Content: The hotel was much more "Hollywood" in person than it appeared in pictures online. It was very elegant, clean and the staff were all very accommodating. We stayed in the basic King size bed room on the 6th floor over looking the pool and fireplace. I didn't hear a peep from the near by 405 freeway which was a plus considering the other reviews which complain so much about it. Our room was clean. Our bed was fluffy and sturdy. The LCD screen tv was do'able. My only gripe was the expensive valet and the cleaning lady barged into our room while we were watching tv. It was one of those knock-knock "HOUSE KEEPING" all in one instance situation. Overall, my experience at Hotel Angeleno was excellent and I would definitely stay here again. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Need a car!!!!”
Reviews.Author: P0ppyfield
Reviews.Content: Hotel was lovely and staff at first were very courtious and helpful, that was until we didnt book any trips through them! Restaurant on the topfloor was nice with high quality food and the bar served for the majority of the day. we did however attempt to open a tab for drinks to which they added another two dollars to the bill! location and views left a lot to be desired, we were very much out of the centre of things, more than we realised we would be. to compensate this the hotel very generously puts on a courtesy car to take you anywhere within a three mile radius, and although this doesnt get you very far (not really out of Brentwood) it is a nice gesture nonetheless. for those of you who do have a car, this would probably be a good venue for you as it is literally straight off the freeway (not really that noisy either) however dispite the the cleanliness and comfort of the hotel, it wasn't our favourite stop on our journey.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms but Hotel needs help with customer service”
Reviews.Author: Jasara
Reviews.Content: So during booking of our room I must confess I did have some issues although I have stayed at the location before and love their rooms and location. My husband and I truly love to come to the Angeleno Hotel but one thing I seem to run into every time when booking is customer service. On their website they say that they will beat any other rate by matching the lower rate and giving 10% off. Although I called the reservationist after finding a deal on expedia and the reservationist and the location manager would not honor this guarentee. I really would not make a stink about the issue but I also am one of their Joy of Life members and I was told by the club membership represitive that I was to recieve not only a complimentary beverage of my preference upon arrival but also a room upgrade. When I asked the room upgrade they told me that I must be mistaken. Although I love the Hotel my next trip to LA I will probably consider somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Dark & Dirty”
Reviews.Author: FlowerPower25
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay at a hotel that it constantly dark even at 12pm during the day this is the place for you. I think they like keeping it dark so that they don't have to keep it clean. My room had a layer of dust on everything not to mention the cobwebs on the ceiling. I was afraid to go barefoot as I knew there were things crawling around on the floor that I couldn't see. My sheets were ripped and even through I'd empty out any glasses and put them on the desk they were never removed until I put them in the hallway. Only somewhat decent service was from room service who were friendly. I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: heetesh
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really nice. The rooms are a reasonable size. The beds are very comfy. The location is good to B'hills and the beach. There are bus services just outside the hotel on the right and over the road. (The Big Blus Bus is the better one to get on rather than the Metro).The Hotel also provides a free shuttle service to take you anywhere within a 3 mile radius, a brilliant perk! The upstairs bar and its views are amazing. The food in the restaurant is not all that considering the prices. Overall, a good stay and I would recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Angeleno Magic”
Reviews.Author: markjones5150
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights in the Angeleno and throughly enjoyed our stay. Our room was partcially facing the Getty Museum and overlooking the Freeway. The rooms are a reasonable size and furnished to a very high standard including flat screen TVs. Huge windows that do an adequate job suppressing the noise of the freeway. That said, if you are a very light sleeper, ask to be placed at the back of the hotel, further away from the noise of the early morning traffic. This is a very busy stretch of road. The rooftop restaurant has spectacular views but one word of warning, its expensive and not very good food. All the hotel staff were more the accomodating but appreciate that this hotel operates valet parking only. There is no option to self park. You'll be charged for the valet parking at the end of your stay. The location is excellent for getting about in LA just on the edge of Bel Air and Sunset. That said you really do need a car to get around in LA....otherwise it's gonna cost you a fortune in cabs. Would stay again and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “The reception staff were great!”
Reviews.Author: alice1964
Reviews.Content: I stayed here two nights and just loved it! I was attending a seminar, and the organizers suggested three hotels. I chose this one, as it was the least expensive. The hotel staff were all great, especially the front desk. I enjoyed the trendy design, the bar on the top floor, and the bed was very comfy. This hotel has a great location by the 405, but that does mean that you hear the traffic. It was more like "white noise" to me, but if you need a super-quiet environment, then the noise might bother you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, staff unhelpful”
Reviews.Author: chinBoston
Reviews.Content: When I arrived at the Angeleno at 2:45 p.m., they didn't have a room for me. Check-in was at 3, but I've never arrived at 2:45 somewhere with nothing available. No problem, I figured. I'll just change, take a dip in the pool for a few minutes, and I'll be all set. I came back in at 3:15, and they told me it would be at least another 30 minutes! I changed again (in the lobby bathroom) and went for a run, asking that they comp my first night of parking ($18) for the inconvenience. When I returned, they led me to a double room, even though I had requested a king. They immediately accommodated my request to move to another room, but when I got there I found that the TV wasn't working. By this time, I just wanted to take a shower and relax, but I needed to get this taken care of first. I called the front desk five times before they sent someone up. The rest of my stay was really nice, but when they slid the bill under the door at the end of my stay, they neglected to comp one night of parking as they had promised. I brought this to their attention and came back later, and then they mistakenly comp'ed all three nights of parking. Which was nice for me, but interesting that they got even this wrong (although it was in my favor). Overall, the staff was very pleasant, but they just seemed inept. I found out the reason I wasn't able to check in on time (I wasn't the only one -- the lobby was full of travelers waiting) is because they held a staff meeting right before check-in time. Not smart. It's a nice place and would easily get four stars if they had their act together.

Reviews.Title: “Very cute!”
Reviews.Author: Danni0005
Reviews.Content: Very cute and hip. Rooms are small but darling. THey said we had 2 queens but it was definately 2 doubles. Bathrom small. Not enough towels. Had a freeway side room but wasn't that bad noise wise. Lounge up tp was GREAT. Food was delicious. Pretty expenisve, but it is LA. Bed veryt comfy. Why don;t they just put parking in the price of the room? Great location. Close to Rodeo and Robertson. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “An L.A. landmark reborn”
Reviews.Author: dancingnancy
Reviews.Content: The Angeleno is a totally cool renovation of a former Holiday Inn. The round 17-story building is a landmark right at the junction of I-405 and Santa Monica Blvd. It’s really well located for bopping all over the city, in your car, of course. You even need a car to get to the Getty Museum, practically across the street. The rooms (all exactly the same, a la Holiday Inn) are utterly generic boutique-hotel style…all browns, creams, modern, spare. Frankly, they’re pretty boring and unoriginal, BUT they’re much snappier than a traditional Holiday Inn, and they do have all the au courrent bells and whistles. We were only there for one night and didn’t have a chance to use the pool which is very glam. The restaurant is on the top floor and must have a sweet view. Missed that too, but our room service lunch arrived speedily and was very good. We also appreciated the little coffee/news bar off the lobby. The only down side was the noise from the major freeways. There may be quieter rooms facing the Getty. Otherwise, bring ear plugs (always a good idea anywhere you stay

Reviews.Title: “Bring Sewing Kit for Sheets, Earplugs for Noise, Wallet for Cafe, and no ID”
Reviews.Author: freqtrav02
Reviews.Content: I'll start with the good - the bed is really comfortable and the staff is kind. The rooms are pretty nice. I definitely had some issues, though. Noise: I originally was in a room on the 9th floor overlooking the freeway. I went right back downstairs and asked for another room because it sounded like I was in the middle of the freeway. I got moved to a different room on a lower floor that faced the front of the hotel and away from the freeway, but I could still hear the traffic loud and clear throughout the day and the night. I also could hear my neighbors flushing their toilets and drying their hair, as well as the ice machine down the hall. I barely slept the first night, called downstairs to speak with a manager about changing rooms again, but the manager hadn't arrived yet. I asked to have the manager call upon arrival...five days later, I'm about to check out and still haven't heard anything. I would've checked out, but I got the hotel through Hotwire and ahd already paid for it. The Security: On my last night at the hotel, my keycard demagnetized. I went downstairs, and the person behind the desk just asked me what room I was in and gave me a new key. She did not ask for ID. I don't care if my mother were behind the desk, I would've wanted her to ask for ID. It made me a little nervous to think that anyone could go down there and say they were staying in any room and get a key to any room... Rips in the Sheets: I couldn't believe it when I read about ripped sheets in another review before coming, especially at hotel that is almost $300/night, but sure enough, there were rips in the duvet and in the fitted sheet. The rip in the fitted sheet extended from the foot of the bed to the middle of the bed. The Cafe: A bagel and a small bottle of orange juice costs $7.00. And the bagel wasn't even that good.

Reviews.Title: “Loveley Experience and Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Sixty48
Reviews.Content: Spent my 60th birthday on the 24/01/08 at the Angeleno, the room was lovely, the staff really helpful, I would like to personally thank Lesly and Christina on the front desk, Matthew conciege and Mary Manager of the restaurant for their extreme kindness when I lost my camera and very helpful in providing lovely birthday gifts and getting us sorted out with trips etc. It was a shame about the weather but being British we are used to that. Many thanks again to Mary for being especially helpful in locating Camera shops for me to purchase another one in Las Vegas. If I ever return to Los Angeles I will certainly stop at the Angeleno and will also recommend this hotel to my friends. Wonderful people. Many thanks. Melanie Parkin and Pat Gadd

Reviews.Title: “Great decor, but unpolished service”
Reviews.Author: cassie94
Reviews.Content: The hotel has sleek decor and very friendly staff as well as a restaurant with a wonderful view and very tasty food. Really good pastries in the morning at the little store in the lobby. There's a beautiful pool with a fireplace, although it was too windy and cold for us to enjoy it. Rooms were clean. Staff were very friendly. However, service was very spotty: missing towels, missing chair, missing shampoo, empty tissue box, toilet paper holder left in the middle of the bathroom. Staff were powerwashing the gym floor while the gym was supposed to be open for guests' use. Valet only parking, but inattentive staff. Staff were quick to respond to requests, though. Missing items were brought immediately and upon request, parking attendants provided good service. Incorrect charges that we found on our bill were corrected immediately when we checked out, without any fuss. Overall, though, good value. I would stay here again if I needed a hotel in the Brentwood/Westwood area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Location”
Reviews.Author: Taupa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a former Holiday Inn and completely renovated in European Style. Decor is the latest Brown/Blue suede with outstanding comfortable beds and pillows. Extremely well appointed with nice touches such as a plush terry cloth shower curtain and monogrammed towels. The latest style of faucets have been put in. Because the hotel is so conveniently located off the freeway at Sunset Blvd. you will get freeway noise on that side - turn on the air conditioning unit in the summer and you would never know. The hotel is circular and at the top is a fine dining restaurant with a nicely appointed bar. Great views of the Getty Museum and of UCLA and Westwood. Just up the street slip into the Hotel Bel Air for a drink without having to pay the price of their rooms. Extremely convenient for any business traveler into the West LA region and certainly acceptable for the vacation traveler also.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lizziemoves
Reviews.Content: I don't understand the other reviews--they must be written by employees or something---this place is a MESS! The first room they gave me had sheets with RIPS in them--I complained and they switched my room. But if you look closely everything is coming undone here---the chairs by the pool have cigarette burns in them, the walls have splotches and stains. The design is a kind of corporate boutique, lacking any real individuality or quality. Also, the hotel is right on the freeway--at all times the sound of cars zooming through traffic abounds. Yuck! The housekeeper started knocking on my door at 8:15 in the morning. Huh? The "art" in the room is so tacky--like worse than pre fab pottery barn art. The restuarant has a cool view--but the food was mediocre--and my "heirloom tomatoes" were terrible. The people who work here are very nice, but I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “really pleasant stay at this hip, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: LosAngelesCourtney
Reviews.Content: My husband and I live in the Los Angeles area; but, we often travel to local hotels to take a break from our busy household and our three small children. Our stay at the Angelino was one of these quick overnight get-aways, and we loved it. The hotel has been remodeled since it was a "Holiday Inn" and there are virtually no traces of its former self. The room was a little small, but very cozy. The room was pie-shaped, which I thought was unique and interesting. We had a view of the 405 freeway, which doesn't sound cool as I write this, but was actually extremely cool. You feel like you're on top of the freeway, but you don't hear the noise (expensive double-paned glass, probably). At night, the lights on the freeway are especially pretty. The room service was quick and the food was great. The restaurant on the top floor has gorgeous views of Los Angeles. The pool area was small, but very hip, with nice comfortable outdoor furniture. This hotel could get away with charging WAY more for their rooms, but they don't, so that makes me give The Angelino even higher marks. Give it a try!

Reviews.Title: “Good Bye Holiday Inn---Hello Angeleno”
Reviews.Author: Paramourfa
Reviews.Content: What do you do with a circular Holiday Inn on the 405 in Los Angeles? The best possible answer is to sell it and turn it into the Angeleno. This hotel takes everything that Holiday Inn does wrong and makes it right. Great comfortable beds with wonderful linens. New furniture and flat screen televisions. To top it off, all of the personnel from the valets to the desk clerks were friendly and welcoming each and every time we had any contact. The restaurant on the 17th floor has wonderful panoramic views and excellent food for breakfast (the only meal we ate at the hotel). We were really impressed with this hotel and hope to return in the near future. One final note---there is some noise from the 405 freeway. It almost can't be avoided, After a few minutes it seemed to be unobtrusive and sleeping proved to be no problem. Our room was on the 5th floor and was slightly facing the freeway. Other rooms might be even better.

Reviews.Title: “We will always love the Angeleno”
Reviews.Author: mfriedl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Angeleno because it was close to UCLA Medial Center where our baby son was having surgery. We were pretty stressed out when we arrived but were immediately impressed by the professionalism and kindness we encountered by everyone at the Angeleno. People went out of their way to put us at ease and make us comfortable. We had seen the unique circular design of the building as we drove by on the 405 freeway, but we had no idea that the rooms were so well appointed, particularly the linens. Our son has now recovered and we are glad this episode is behind us, but we will always have a warm spot in our hearts for the Hotel Angeleno, and we look forward to staying there again just for fun!

Reviews.Title: “Great little boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: RkyMtnHi
Reviews.Content: I only stayed here one night, but it was a fabulous stay! Everyone who worked there was so friendly and nice and all my co-workers said they had the same experience. The hotel has dimmed lighting and cool music that makes you relax right away and the room rates are extremely reasonable (they even worked with our nonprofit to give us a lower rate). The room I was in was on the second floor--the bed was so comfortable; a very comfy mattress and soft sheets. The plasma TV was nice and there was free wifi in the room. The bathroom was kind of small, but it was well-appointed with luxury shampoo/conditioner/lotion and little extras like containers of Q-tips and cotton balls. I checked in at about 11:30 pm after traveling all day and I was starving. The receptionist said that room service was available until midnight. The menu was incredible--I ordered light things like spinach cooked in garlic and herbs and Parmesan polenta. I thought room service might be cranky since it was so late, but they were very nice. I ordered breakfast in the room too and it was also delicious--the menu offers things like chicken-apple sausage, fluffy eggs and amazing potatoes. I heard the hotel used to be a Holiday Inn back in the day--it's a tall, round hotel, so everyone has a view. I was sad to only stay one night, but I'm glad to know I now have a "go-to" hotel in LA!

Reviews.Title: “Very Cool and Fun”
Reviews.Author: cyberl
Reviews.Content: At first I thought the Angeleno would be all marketing gimmick and poor service. True, their advertizing is over the top: no, staying at Joie de Vivre hotels is not like going to a farmer's market (a silly jingle says when you are on hold on their phone). I would have liked it much less if it were like going to a farmer's maket! ;-) The design is very cool and the rooms incredibly confortable (even if one hears the ocassional roar from 405 nearby). The pool is so very pleasant, especially in the evening to enjoy a drink by the fireplace after a dive. The gym is small but was enough. But the biggest surprise of the stay was the wonderful West Restaurant & Lounge on the 17th floor. The food is great and the band playing Monday (Jazz) and Thursday (Jazz/Funk) was excellent---and the groupies even better! I would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in a convenient spot”
Reviews.Author: dklein
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just stayed here for a night so that we could be close to our Halloween party this year. The location is superb, right off the 405 freeway and a quick drive to Westwood (not 5 minutes), Brentwood (not 5 minutes), Beverly Hills (maybe 15 minutes?), Santa Monica (maybe 20 minutes?). It's nice to be so close to the freeway if you need to travel a bit during your stay. The price was fairly reasonable; the rooms very nicely appointed and comfortable with comfortable beds and nice bathrooms. Our room had a balcony and was perched almost above the freeway. Pretty nifty even if I am a light sleeper. Just know that the hotel is right off the freeway. I am a very light sleeper and was surprised that the noise of cars on the freeway didn't bother me. Again, I was not bothered by the sound of cars rushing bar. With the balcony door open, it's loud. With the door closed, it's surprisingly much more quiet, almost like a muted rushing river. It was not bothersome. Similarly, our room was adjacent to the ice machine. I usually ask to be put far from the ice machine and the elevators. This ice machine was loud and faced the hall but somehow, the door to our room did a remarkable job of silencing it. If you have a room facing south, I'd imagine you'd get a view of the city but I liked having the view facing north up the Sepulveda Canyon just as much. The place has a cool 'W' kind of feel to it although we didn't have time to check out the bar or restaurant. Valet parking is $18 for overnight parking...somewhat of a standard practice these days. The valets are attentive and prompt. I'd stay here again, absolutely.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: DowntownMom
Reviews.Content: Located right next to the 405 freeway, between Westwood (UCLA) and Santa Monica, The Angeleno is convenient and comfortable. I was put here by work and had low expectations. I'd driven by the remarkable round building many times. On the bad side, you need a car for everything from this road side location. On the great side, the service was lovely, the room large and comfortable, the room service open, the cable and wireless functioning. The bathroom was small but clean. I'd stay here again, no problem.

Reviews.Title: “nice boutique hotel in westwood”
Reviews.Author: zeenichka
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel near Brentwood/Bel Aire/Westwood and the price is a bit reasonable compared to some of the places in this area. We had a really nice room, king bed (very comfortable bed), flat screen T.V.. We were on the 11th floor and had a great view all the way to catalina. Only draw back....there is a little bit of humming noise from the freeway if the window is open. Otherwise all was great!! There is a nice restaurant on the top level that has a great view. They serve breakfast, lunch and dinner. There is a small bar as well.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy at the Hotel Angeleno”
Reviews.Author: LovingtheTravelling
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the freeway and UCLA-close Hotel Angeleno for one night. We found the rooms well furnished, the beds quite comfy, and bedding luxurious. The room service menu is versatile, with the food delicious and service excellent. The front desk and housekeeping was responsive to our requests. When we return for future overnight visits, we will utilize this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Noisey”
Reviews.Author: jobcpa
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Angeleno is next to the 405 Freeway. The heating / air system is a window box. This is not a hotel if you want to get a good night sleep. I woke up early (because of the noise)... to find out that room service and the dinning room open at 6:30 (it is not 24/7).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service at the Angeleno”
Reviews.Author: FrequentFlier_CT
Reviews.Content: I'm a frequent business traveler and can honestly say the Hotel Angeleno is the best value in the area. The service is *exemplary*, the location is easy to get to, and the beds are so-o-o-o comfortable. Everything the business traveler could want. It leaves everything else in the price range in the dust.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but felt slightly uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: radis
Reviews.Content: Nice room recently renovated. Staff available and polite. ONLY valet parking, 18$ per night + tip. Overall a good experience, but there is a kind of "trendy, showing off " attitude which makes a casual tourist feel somehow out of place... maybe it's just the way things are in Los Angeles... Also they had a private party one of the evenings which meant no pool available for clients and loud music during the night ! They were basically sacrificing the customers for making more money with the private party...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CarolMenloPark
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Angeleno Hotel for a weekend while visiting our daughter who is a student at UCLA. I had read a rather negative review, so wasn't expecting too much, but it was the only hotel with availability. How wrong the other review was! The staff were very kind , helpful & welcoming. Our room was beautiful and the bed was so comfortable with luxurious bed linens. We didn't go to the restaurant, but enjoyed the workout room 2 mornings and the nice pool area. I would say the only, slightly negative is that the hotel is right next to highway 405, but we weren't bothered by that ,even in our room. At the pool, they have nice soothing music playing, so you aren't really aware of any noise (very clever). We would stay there again in a minute and also recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy !!”
Reviews.Author: MichaelMancini
Reviews.Content: We've been at Angeleno LA for only one night, coming from Hawaii, going back home to Italy. The hotel is in a perfect location, between Bel Air and Santa Monica, just near the houses of Dustin Hoffman, Harrison Ford, Tom Criuse, etc. It's on the highway exit and this means you can hear the noise of the traffic, in this case I suggest to have an higher floor room looking to the sea. The hotel is simply trendy! The swimming pool has a big fireplace and very confortable lounge chairs. In the roof there's a very nice bar and restaurant. One week before I'd been to the Biltmore in LA downtown that's very different. I liked both the hotels, in this case the location in much better and you feel the real atmosphere of the high class quartier of LA. I recommend this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay - Angeleno Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mickb42
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Angeleno Hotel in order to help our son move into his college housing. All the staff members at the Angeleno were helpful, courteous, and very willing to share any information they couold to make our stay as pleasant as possible. The food from the restaurant was excellent, as was the room service. The facilities were clean and well kept, and our stay was a real treat! We will be returning to visit our son frequently during the school year, and we will always make the Angeleno our first choice to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but wouldn't choose it again”
Reviews.Author: Kayelle
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location - easy drive to Santa Monica and Beverly Hills, where we had meetings all week. Nicely decorated rooms - although rather small. We only had a shower - no bath tub - not sure if this is the same in all rooms. Front staff was friendly upon check in. Pool area is very nice - although does not get vey much sun in the afternoon. Problems were the freeway noise - unreal - doesn't matter which side of the hotel your room is on, had to use the A/C to drown it out. The cleaning staff was not very attentive, bathrom not cleaned well daily, had to call down for replacement supplies. Bathrobes were missing. Housekeeping walked into the room unannounced one afternoon which was a bit startling. Number of towels each day was inconsistent - had to dry with a facecloth at one point! Just little details that should really be attended to. Also - disliked the valet parking, (which is mandatory) while the valet staff was generally pleasant, it was very inconvenient to call down every time we needed to leave - phone rang busy, often times had to wait for some time for our vehicle. Overall - it was an okay experience and I would recommend this as a good place to stay for a night or 2, but we were there a week - and feel that perhaps another hotel would provide a much more comfortable stay, and will be looking to book elsewhere for our week in October.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tlucin
Reviews.Content: In my first trip to los Angeles, i stay in Angelino´s hotel, i resume my experience in one word Excellent, the room, was just like yo see at the web site, very clean, confortable, the bed was great, the hotel have a little market that is small but have the necessary to grab something to eat, the restaurant was very good too, when i arrive, i surprise becasuse the location is almost between highways, but the kind man who take my suitcase to my room give a tour for the hotel and inform me that they have a complimentary shuttle wherevere i want to 3miles around, and they also can recomend me where to shop and eat at this shuttle, i just have to ak 30 minutes before, and them they sent for me too. The price was ok, $200,00 seens reasonable for a great room and we are only 18minutes of beberly hills and sigthseens, Los angeles, is huge so i thinks this is agreat location, reasonable price, i truly recomend but for singles, couples and buissness.

Reviews.Title: “Love the place!”
Reviews.Author: 7diamond
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. The rooms are modern. The beds are very comfortable. It's very clean. The staff is friendly and offers exceptional service. Room service is a plus; the food is very good! They have a shuttle service that will take you right into Westwood and pick you up when you are ready to relax at the hotel. Love the location. You will come back; just like I have done.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, Clean, Modern Hotel w/ Attentive & Friendly Staff!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Heatcmp
Reviews.Content: From the moment we booked the reservation, this hotel proved to be more than just a regular hotel. The reservation agent was extremely warm & friendly as if it were an independant bed & breakfast run by a family not in any rush to get on to the next call. Upon arrival, we were given no hassles about valet parking, the check-in was smooth, the room was clean. The deocr is modern, simple w/ clean lines, warm tones and not cluttered. The amenities were high-end too. The shampoo didn't actually make your hair feel like sticks after using it:) Room service was friendly, the food was cooked to perfection & the quality of the food was superb. I have a hotel background and have also worked as a conference planner for years so, I can be critical & this one was nothing but top-notch. Hope you share my experience.

Reviews.Title: “We're Not Easy To Please”
Reviews.Author: beachbound33
Reviews.Content: Hotel Angeleno far and away exceeded my every expectation. I absolutely love the warm and inviting atmosphere. As a former hotel administrator I tend to pay close attention to detail, especially in how the staff treat their guests. I can honestly say that in all the years of hotel employment or personal hotel visits, I have never encountered a more outgoing group of employees. I literally felt like I was in "their" home. What was even better was the genuine sincerity each staff member displayed. The pool area was occupied with an Emmy function; however as the Banquet staff were breaking down the tables, they invited me in. I didn't want to be in the way but they were so accommodating that they were nice enough to set up a lounge area for me, right in the midst of their busy schedule.
